title: Maria Ressa delivers the Commencement Address | Harvard Commencement 2024
desc: On May 23, 2024, Maria Ressa, a recipient of the 2021 Nobel Peace Prize, addressed the graduating Class of 2024.
speech_raw: 1    00:00:01.320 --> 00:00:03.720    - Thank you, President Garber        2    00:00:03.720 --> 00:00:06.720    and thank you, former President Gay        3    00:00:06.720 --> 00:00:10.719    who called me last year    to extend this offer.        4    00:00:10.719 --> 00:00:13.886    (audience applauding)        5    00:00:24.875 --> 00:00:26.580    It's an incredible honor        6    00:00:26.580 --> 00:00:30.457    to address the distinguished    Harvard faculty,        7    00:00:30.457 --> 00:00:33.723    the mysterious Harvard Corporation,        8    00:00:36.090 --> 00:00:39.840    and the loving friends and family        9    00:00:39.840 --> 00:00:44.840    who have traveled far and close    to be here with you today.        10    00:00:46.830 --> 00:00:51.830    But wait, most of all, despite everything,        11    00:00:51.960 --> 00:00:54.360    because you worked really hard,        12    00:00:54.360 --> 00:00:57.210    I am so 00:01:04.594 --> 00:01:07.761    (audience applauding)        16    00:01:13.902 --> 00:01:18.210    This was a harder speech to    write than the Nobel lecture,        17    00:01:18.210 --> 22    00:01:37.890 --> 00:01:42.180    to turn crisis into opportunity.        23    00:01:42.180 --> 00:01:46.830    No one knows this better    than the class of 2024.        24    00:01:46.830 --> In about three months,        90    00:05:27.180 --> 00:05:30.152    I thought I was gonna have    to do a workflow for arrests.        91    00:05:30.152 --> 00:05:34.590    But before it all ended, 00:04:39.300    (audience laughing)        89    00:04:39.300 --> 00:04:41.160    Five months ago,        90    00:04:41.160 --> 00:04:45.450    it seemed impossible that I    would make it to the ceremony,        91    00:04:45.450 --> 00:04:47.550    let alone be here on the stage        92    00:04:47.550 --> 00:04:50.506    with my mom's hero, Tom Hanks.        93    00:04:50.506 --> 00:04:55.506    (audience laughing)    (Vic laughing)        94    00:05:07.200 --> 00:05:09.873    But here I am.        95    00:05:10.804 --> 00:05:13.887    (audience cheering)        96    00:05:19.880 --> 00:05:22.500    And while it's me you    see standing here today,        97    00:05:22.500 --> 00:05:24.600    I do not stand alone.        98    00:05:24.600 --> 00:05:28.410    I haven't taken a single step    alone in the last five months.        99    00:05:28.410 --> 00:05:31.320    Clara wrestled the insurance companies.        100    00:05:31.320 --> 00:05:33.273    Ketaki cooked me biryani.        101    00:05:34.350 --> 00:05:37.620    Bethany managed my entire calendar.        102    00:05:37.620 --> 00:05:40.500    Countless friends, family, and strangers        103    00:05:40.500 --> 00:05:43.530    have shown up for me in ways    that I couldn't have imagined.        104    00:05:43.530 --> 00:05:47.100    There will come a moment for each of us        105    00:05:47.100 --> 00:05:49.473    where we realize that    we cannot do it alone,        106    00:05:50.310 --> 00:05:52.350    in fact, that we have never done it alone        107 say this,        110    00:05:58.260 --> 00:06:00.060    'cause I really know it to be true.        111    00:06:00.060 --> 00:06:02.673    We need each other.        112    00:06:04.107 --> 00:06:07.357    (audience applauding)        113    00:06:10.440 --> 00:06:13.290    In your moments of doubt,        114    00:06:13.290 --> 00:06:14.440    who was there with you?        115 business;        120    00:06:32.850 --> 00:06:35.487    we are each other's magnitude and bond."        121    00:06:36.780 --> 00:06:40.833    I was fortunate to find my    harvest here at Harvard.        122    00:06:43.560 --> 00:06:46.890    In the process of chasing your dreams,        123    00:06:46.890 --> 00:06:51.270    you will need people to    comfort you, to coach you,        124 And when you find yourself        127    00:06:56.700 --> 00:06:59.550    in your own cold Michigan winter,        128    00:06:59.550 --> 00:07:01.833    you will need people    to walk alongside title: President Larry Bacow Closing | Harvard Commencement 2023
desc: Harvard President Larry Bacow closed the 2023 Commencement Exercises. speech_raw: 1    00:00:00.690 --> 00:00:03.390    - I suspect that many of    you are sitting here today        2    00:00:03.390 --> 00:00:06.270    as newly minted Harvard graduates        3    00:00:06.270 --> 00:00:08.940    wondering what the future holds for you.        4    00:00:08.940 --> 00:00:11.010    I actually can relate to that.        5    00:00:11.010 --> 00:00:13.080    As you know, this is my last commencement        6    00:00:13.080 --> 00:00:16.560    and I'm actually pondering    the same question.        7    00:00:16.560 --> 00:00:20.520    Like you, I'm contemplating    what happens next.        8    00:00:20.520 --> 00:00:23.010    Whatever your dreams are today,        9    00:00:23.010 --> 00:00:26.520    I wish for you what you wish for yourself,        10    00:00:26.520 --> 00:00:29.490    and I hope that living a meaningful life        11    00:00:29.490 --> 00:00:31.920    is high on your list.        12    00:00:31.920 --> 00:00:33.153    What do I mean by that?        13    00:00:34.140 --> 00:00:37.390    You've worked extremely hard    to earn your Harvard degree        14    00:00:38.250 --> 00:00:40.680    but you're also extremely fortunate        15    00:00:40.680 --> 00:00:41.943    to be sitting here today.        16    00:00:42.840 --> 00:00:47.840    With education, with good    fortune comes responsibility,        17    00:00:47.940 --> 00:00:52.353    including looking beyond    your success to help others.        18    00:00:53.490 --> 00:00:57.060    No one accomplishes anything    in life on their own.        19    00:00:57.060 --> 00:00:59.010    At the beginning of this ceremony,        20    00:00:59.010 --> 00:01:02.160    I asked you to recognize    your friends and families        21    00:01:02.160 --> 00:01:05.640    who have supported you, and you did,        22    00:01:05.640 --> 00:01:09.033    but you have also received    support from countless others.        23    00:01:09.990 --> 00:01:13.890    For example, those who    pushed and encouraged you        24    00:01:13.890 --> 00:01:17.160    and who may have    recognized something in you        25    00:01:17.160 --> 00:01:20.730    that you did not recognize in yourself.        26    00:01:20.730 --> 00:01:22.800    Those who had confidence in you        27    00:01:22.800 --> 00:01:27.570    even before you proved    yourself worthy of their trust.        28    00:01:27.570 --> 00:01:31.053    Those who extended themselves    to open doors for you.        29    00:01:32.070 --> 00:01:35.880    And to all of these, you can    add the invisible others,        30    00:01:35.880 --> 00:01:39.780    those who volunteered their    time to create organizations        31    00:01:39.780 --> 00:01:42.330    that have been central to your life.        32    00:01:42.330 --> 00:01:45.120    Those who worked to build institutions        33    00:01:45.120 --> 00:01:49.890    that nurtured your capacities,    talents, and ambitions.        34    00:01:49.890 --> 00:01:52.200    Those who helped to sustain        35    00:01:52.200 --> 00:01:55.140    and strengthen this great university,        36    00:01:55.140 --> 00:01:59.160    which I hope has left    its mark on each of you        37    00:01:59.160 --> 00:02:03.303    and from which you now    graduate, I could go on.        38    00:02:04.410 --> 00:02:07.590    Soon, it will be your turn    to extend the helping hand        39    00:02:07.590 --> 00:02:10.890    and to create hope and    opportunity for others.        40    00:02:10.890 --> 00:02:15.270    We expect this of you and even more.        41    00:02:15.270 --> 00:02:17.790    I've never met anyone who thinks        42    00:02:17.790 --> 00:02:20.910    the world we live in is perfect.        43    00:02:20.910 --> 00:02:23.220    This is a statement that's equally true        44    00:02:23.220 --> 00:02:27.780    of liberals and conservatives,    Democrats and Republicans,        45    00:02:27.780 --> 00:02:32.010    and those across the political spectrum.        46    00:02:32.010 --> 00:02:35.880    So, if you believe the world is imperfect,        47    00:02:35.880 --> 00:02:38.580    the only way it will get better        48    00:02:38.580 --> 00:02:42.783    is if good people like    you work to repair it.        49    00:02:43.680 --> 00:02:46.743    This is now your responsibility.        50    00:02:48.000 --> 00:02:50.520    Harvard gave me a great education,        51    00:02:50.520 --> 00:02:54.270    but it also raised my    expectations for myself.        52    00:02:54.270 --> 00:02:57.840    It opened my eyes to what is possible.        53    00:02:57.840 --> 00:02:59.970    At my commencement,        54    00:02:59.970 --> 00:03:04.020    I never imagined that someday    I would be standing here        55    00:03:04.020 --> 00:03:08.610    giving the final remarks    at your commencement.        56    00:03:08.610 --> 00:03:11.670    I hope as you find your way through life        57    00:03:11.670 --> 00:03:16.080    that you will have similarly    pleasant surprises.        58    00:03:16.080 --> 00:03:17.910    And now to all of those        59    00:03:17.910 --> 00:03:20.370    who helped me through the path of life,        60    00:03:20.370 --> 00:03:22.320    to those who gave me opportunities        61    00:03:22.320 --> 00:03:24.630    that I never could have imagined,        62    00:03:24.630 --> 00:03:29.310    to those who gave me the    extraordinary responsibility        63    00:03:29.310 --> 00:03:32.670    to lead Harvard over    these past five years,        64    00:03:32.670 --> 00:03:36.510    and those who helped    me do it, I thank you.        65    00:03:36.510 --> 00:03:40.380    And to Adele, my wife of 48 years,        66    00:03:40.380 --> 00:03:43.860    who's been my partner of    this incredible journey        67    00:03:43.860 --> 00:03:46.860    and all others, thank you.        68    00:03:46.860 --> 00:03:50.483    I love you.    (audience applauding)        69    00:03:53.429 --> 00:03:55.920    As I prepare to take my leave,        70    00:03:55.920 --> 00:04:00.600    I'm reminded of a quotation    from a "Book of Wisdom."        71    00:04:00.600 --> 00:04:03.510    It's called Ethics of Our Fathers.        72    00:04:03.510 --> 00:04:07.593    It's the meditation of a great    teacher and a great scholar.        73    00:04:08.790 --> 00:04:11.820    I have learned much from my teachers,        74    00:04:11.820 --> 00:04:16.820    more from my colleagues,    but most from my students.        75    00:04:16.980 --> 00:04:21.980    To the class of 2023, thank    you for teaching me so well.        76    00:04:23.250 --> 00:04:25.830    I'm grateful to each and every one of you        77    00:04:25.830 --> 00:04:30.830    for being a constant source    of hope and optimism.        78    00:04:30.930 --> 00:04:35.930    Serving as your president has    been the privilege of my life.        79    00:04:36.360 --> 00:04:39.090    I look forward eagerly to celebrating all        80    00:04:39.090 --> 00:04:41.070    that you will do for the world        81    00:04:41.070 --> 00:04:45.360    and all those whose    lives will be made better        82    00:04:45.360 --> 00:04:47.640    by your good work.        83    00:04:47.640 --> 00:04:52.080    To the class of 2023, thank you, farewell        84    00:04:52.080 --> 00:04:56.033    and God speed.    (audience applauding)

title: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern | Harvard Commencement 2022
desc: On May 26, 2022, New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern addressed the graduating Class of 2022.
speech_raw: 1    00:00:02.171 --> 00:00:06.171    (Speaking Te Reo Maori)     E oku manukura, nga pou haemata o te ngahere.        2    00:00:06.171 --> 00:00:11.248    e Piko o Te Mahuri, tera te tipu o te rakau.        3    00:00:11.416 --> 00:00:18.082    E tipu, e rea, ka puta, ka ora.    Tena koutou katoa.        4    00:00:19.050 --> 00:00:24.050    President Bacow, Provost Garber,    governing boards and deans,        5    00:00:25.070 --> 00:00:28.943    and most importantly, graduates.        6    00:00:34.410 --> 00:00:37.360    In Te Reo Maori, the language    of the indigenous people        7    00:00:37.360 --> 00:00:39.690    of Aotearoa New Zealand,        8 Zealanders studying here.        22    00:01:31.785 --> 00:01:34.535    (crowd clapping)        23    00:01:38.220 --> 00:01:42.639    And statistically, at least    one of them will be my cousin.        24    00:01:42.639 --> 00:01:45.389    (crowd laughing)        25    00:01:47.140 --> 00:01:50.980    But then there are some moments    that serve to remind you        26    00:01:50.980 -->  41    00:02:55.070 --> 00:02:56.473    about Benazir Bhutto.        42    00:02:57.700 --> 00:03:00.660    She was the first Muslim    female prime minister        43    00:03:00.660 --> 00:03:02.940 speech_raw: 1    00:00:01.000 --> 00:00:08.000    FELLOW STUDENTS, PROUD    PARENTS, ESTEEMED FACULTY, AND        2    00:00:08.000 --> 00:00:11.666    RANDOM PEOPLE WHO JUST WATCH    THESE THINGS ON YOUTUBE: HELLO        3    00:00:11.666 --> 00:00:16.766    AND WELCOME.    YOUNGER SIBLINGS, A BIRD IN THE        4    00:00:16.766 --> 00:00:21.866    HAND IS WORTH TWO IN THE BUSH.    NOW, I DON'T KNOW EXACTLY WHAT        5    00:00:21.866 --> 00:00:25.400    THIS MEANS, BUT I THOUGHT YOU    GUYS SHOULD START GETTING READY        6    00:00:25.400 --> 00:00:27.266    TO RECEIVE UNEARNED, PATRONIZING    ADVICE FROM US FROM THIS DAY        7    00:00:27.266 --> 00:00:32.066    FORWARD.    SOME OF YOU ARE PROBABLY LOOKING        8    00:00:32.066 --> 00:00:36.200    UP AT THIS STAGE RIGHT NOW AND    THINKING, "WHO IS THIS STONE COLD        9    00:00:36.200 --> 00:00:40.733    HOTTIE AND HOW DOES SHE HAVE    SUCH AMAZING HAIR?"        10    00:00:40.733 --> 00:00:46.533    WELL, THAT'S MAYOR MICHELLE WU,        11    00:00:46.533 --> 00:00:49.800    AND I HOPE SHE'LL ADDRESS        12    00:00:49.800 --> 00:00:57.633    THIS IN HER REMARKS.    WRITING THIS SPEECH WAS TOUGH        13    00:00:57.633 --> 00:01:02.966    BECAUSE, LET'S FACE IT, THIS IS    HARVARD-- A PLACE WHERE DREAMS        14    00:01:02.966 --> 00:01:08.233    ARE NARROWED DOWN TO SLIGHTLY    MORE LUCRATIVE DREAMS?        15    00:01:08.233 --> 00:01:11.000    A PLACE THAT REMINDS US THAT, IN    THIS COUNTRY, YOU CAN BE        16    00:01:11.000 --> 00:01:16.033    ACCEPTEDNTO E WORLD'S MOST    ILLUSTRIOUS ACADEMIC INSTITUTION        17    00:01:16.033 --> 00:01:23.466    THROUGH THE SWEAT OF YOUR OWN    BROW, JUST LIKE YOUR OLD MAN AND        18    00:01:23.466 --> 00:01:27.633    HIS OLD MAN BEFORE HIM.    [ Laughter ]        19    00:01:27.633 --> 00:01:30.466    A PLACE THAT MEETS 100% OF    FINANCIAL NEED FOR ALL STUDENTS.        20    00:01:30.466 --> 00:01:33.900    THIS ONE HAS NO PUNCHLINE, IT'S    JUST AN AMAZING THING.        21    00:01:33.900 --> 00:01:40.766    THANKS, DADDY HARVARD.    BUT YEAH, WRITING THIS SPEECH        22    00:01:40.766 --> 00:01:47.066    WAS TOUGH, WHICH IS WHY I WROTE    IT THE SAME WAY I WROTE ALL MY        23    00:01:47.066 --> 00:01:49.766    ASSIGNMENTS AS A SENIOR: NOT    HUNGOVER, NOT BURIED IN LAMONT        24    00:01:49.766 --> 00:01:51.333    BASEMENT, AND NOT LATE LAST    NIGHT BETWEEN THE HOURS OF 3:00        25    00:01:51.333 --> 00:01:55.866    AND 7:00 A.M.    MY DILIGENCE AND RIGOR OVER THE        26    00:01:55.866 --> 00:02:00.233    COURSE OF THE LAST FOUR YEARS    ARE MUCH LIKE THE MILLIONS        27    00:02:00.233 --> 00:02:03.166    JEFFREY EPSTEIN DONATED TO    HARVARD: THEY HAVE AGED VERY        28    00:02:03.166 --> 00:02:17.933    WELL.    BUT --        29    00:02:17.933 --> 00:02:24.400    [APPLAUSE]    IT'S THANKS TO NOT DOING        30    00:02:24.400 --> 00:02:26.300    ANY OF THESE THINGS THAT I CAN    CONFIDENTLY BEGIN BY SAYING:        31    00:02:26.300 --> 00:02:28.100    CONGRATULATIONS, CLASS OF 2022.    ALL OF US ARE HERE TODAY BECAUSE        32    00:02:28.100 --> 00:02:39.300    THIS IS THE LOCATION THAT WAS    CHOSEN.        33    00:02:39.300 --> 00:02:42.000    [ Laughter ]    SOME OF US ARE ALSO TECHNICALLY        34    00:02:42.000 --> 00:02:43.100    HERE BECAUSE WE WERE DRIVEN BY    THE RELENTLESS FEAR OF        35    00:02:43.100 --> 00:02:44.400    DISAPPOINTING OUR PARENTS. "GREATEST CLASS BY FAR".        40    00:03:02.733 --> 00:03:07.233    THE HARVARD OF CLASSES, IF YOU    WILL.        41    00:03:07.233 --> 00:03:13.000    OR, IN THE WORDS OF DAVID MALAN,    THE TOMORROW, WE GRADUATE FROM        57    00:04:15.333 --> 00:04:21.466    HARVARD.    FOUR YEARS AGO... ISH, WE        58    00:04:21.466 --> 00:04:23.066    FINALLY ARRIVED ON THIS    BEAUTIFUL CAMPUS, EXCITED AND A        59    00:04:23.066 --> 00:04:26.633    LITTLE NERVOUS.    WE'D WRITTEN OUR APPLICATION        60    00:04:26.633 --> 00:04:29.333    ESSAYS ABOUT OUR PLANS TO PURSUE    LIVES OF SERVICE AND SAVED SOME        61    00:04:29.333 --> 00:04:34.633    TURTLES, AND THOSE OF US WHO    JUST WANTED TO MAKE BANK HAD        62    00:04:34.633 --> 00:04:38.066    WRITTEN ABOUT OUR PLANS TO    PURSUE LIVES OF SERVICE AND SAVE        63    00:04:38.066 --> 00:04:39.466    SOME TURTLES.    WE'D WRITTEN ABOUT THE STRUGGLES        64    00:04:39.466 --> 00:04:42.333    WE'D FACED AND THE SACRIFICES    OUR FAMILIES HAD MADE IN THE        65    00:04:42.333 --> 00:04:48.666    HOPES OF ONE DAY SENDING US TO    AN INSTITUTION LIKE THIS ONE.        66    00:04:48.666 --> 00:04:53.733    AND THOSE OF US WITH NEITHER    STRUGGLES NOR SACRIFICES HAD        67    00:04:53.733 --> 00:04:57.800    WRITTEN ABOUT OUR GREAT-GREAT    AUNT HELEN, WHO CROSSED THE        68    00:04:57.800 --> 00:04:59.966    MEDITERRANEAN ONE-LEGGED IN THE    LATE 1800s IN A BRAVE DEFIANCE        69    00:04:59.966 --> 00:05:03.833    OF LEPROSY THAT WAS ABSOLUTELY    RELATED TO OUR INVOLVEMENT IN        70    00:05:03.833 --> 00:05:10.733    THE HIGH SCHOOL'S SWIM TEAM.    [ Laughter ]        71    00:05:10.733 --> 00:05:13.600    BUT, SOMEHOW, HARVARD SAW    SOMETHING IN EACH OF US.        72    00:05:13.600 --> 00:05:16.166    IF THERE ARE TWO WORDS THAT    COULD SUM UP THE FOUR YEARS THAT        73    00:05:16.166 --> 00:05:20.466    ENSUED, THEY WOULD BE    "TRANSFORMATIVE EXPERIENCE," A        74    00:05:20.466 --> 00:05:25.800    SENTENCE DEAN KHURANA BRIBED ME    TO SAY EARLIER TODAY.        75    00:05:25.800 --> 00:05:29.833    BUT HE WAS RIGHT; THE TIME WE    SPENT HERE REALLY DID TRANSFORM        76    00:05:29.833 --> 00:05:33.400    EACH OF US.    IN MY CASE, I AM NOW A PERSON        77    00:05:33.400 --> 00:05:39.766    WHO NEEDS A JOB, WHEREAS FOUR    YEARS AGO, I WAS JUST A PERSON.        78    00:05:39.766 --> 00:05:45.366    [ Laughter ]    EVERYONE'S EXPERIENCE HERE HAS        79    00:05:45.366 --> 00:05:47.400    BEEN UNIQUE, STARTING WITH THE    DIFFERENT CONCENTRATIONS WE        80    00:05:47.400 --> 00:05:51.500    PURSUED AND THE STEREOTYPES    ATTACHED TO THEM.        81    00:05:51.500 --> 00:05:54.533    ECONOMICS CONCENTRATORS LIKE TO    JOKE THAT THEY'RE SNAKES, AND        82    00:05:54.533 --> 00:05:56.066    THE REST OF US LIKE TO PRETEND    THAT WE HAVEN'T HEARD THAT JOKE        83    00:05:56.066 --> 00:06:02.200    EVERY SINGLE DAY SINCE WE    STARTED COLLEGE.        84    00:06:02.200 --> 00:06:03.333    BUT HONESTLY, I THINK THAT    LABEL'S UNFAIR.        85    00:06:03.333 --> 00:06:04.700    WHY SHOULD ONLY ONE    CONCENTRATION GET ASSIGNED AN        86    00:06:04.700 --> 00:06:08.300    ANIMAL?    SO, I TOOK THE LIBERTY OF COMING        87    00:06:08.300 --> 00:06:13.066    UP WITH A FEW OTHERS.    SOCIAL STUESONCERATORS:        88    00:06:13.066 --> 00:06:18.266    YOU GET THE BLOWFISH.    YOU ARE ACTUALLY INCREDIBLY        89    00:06:18.266 --> 00:06:23.100    INTELLIGENT CREATURES, BUT NO    ONE REALIZES THAT BECAUSE YOU        90    00:06:23.100 --> 00:06:28.000    WERE GIVEN SUCH A STUPID NAME.    WOMEN, GENDER & SEXUALITY        91    00:06:28.000 --> 00:06:31.600    STUDIES CONCENTRATORS: YOU ARE    THE CHACOAN PECCARY, BECAUSE        92    00:06:31.600 --> 00:06:36.033    ACADEMIA ONLY ACKNOWLEDGED YOUR    EXISTENCE IN THE MID-1970s, AND        93    00:06:36.033 --> 00:06:37.700    THE AVERAGE PERSON IS STILL    LIKELY TO DENY YOU'RE A REAL        94    00:06:37.700 --> 00:06:45.566    THING.    GOVERNMENT CONCTRATS: Y        95    00:06:45.566 --> 00:06:55.333    GUYS ARE HUMANS, HUMANS WHO PLAY    LACROSSE.        96    00:06:55.333 --> 00:06:56.633    AND FINALLY, PURE MATH    CONCENTRATORS: YOU ARE THE THREE        97    00:06:56.633 --> 00:07:02.666    TURKEYS WHO MAKE INTERMITTENT    APPEARANCES IN HARVARD YARD.        98    00:07:02.666 --> 00:07:08.700    WE KNOW YOU'RE THERE, BUT YOU    HAVE ONLY BEEN SIGHTED OUTSIDE        99    00:07:08.700 --> 00:07:12.666    TWICE.    IT'S OKAY, GUYS.        100    00:07:12.666 --> 00:07:14.300    I CAN MAKE THAT JOKE BECAUSE I'M    A PURE MATH CONCENTRATOR.        101    00:07:14.300 --> 00:07:15.633    I'M NOT; I JUST WANTED TO GET    THAT ON CAMERA FOR THE PURPOSES        102    00:07:15.633 --> 00:07:19.333    OF MY JOB SEARCH.    REGARDLESS OF WHATE STIED,        103    00:07:19.333 --> 00:07:24.166    THE ONE THING ALL OUR HARVARD    JOURNEYS PROBABLY HAD IN COMMON        104    00:07:24.166 --> 00:07:28.100    AS ANDREW SAID,    WAS THE EXPERIENCE OF REJECTION.        105    00:07:28.100 --> 00:07:30.500    WE GOT REJECTED FROM ON-CAMPUS    PUBLICATIONS, MUSICAL GROUPS,        106    00:07:30.500 --> 00:07:35.866    CLUBS, AND THE SEMI-SECRET,    HYPER-EXCLUSIVE GROUP OF        107    00:07:35.866 --> 00:07:41.700    STUDENTS THAT CALLS FINAL CLUBS    "FINALS CLUBS."        108    00:07:41.700 --> 00:07:43.633    WE GOT REJECTED FROM CLASSES,    INTERNSHIPS, LEADERSHIP        109    00:07:43.633 --> 00:07:49.300    POSITIONS, THE HARVARD    UNDERGRADUATE CLEAN ENERGY        110    00:07:49.300 --> 00:07:50.533    GROUP, THE HARVARD UNDERGRADUATE    CLEAN ENERGY GROUP AGAIN, THE        111    00:07:50.533 --> 00:07:55.866    HARVARD UNDERGRADUATE CLEAN    ENERGY GROUP A THIRD TIME--        112    00:07:55.866 --> 00:07:57.433    SERIOUSLY, GUYS, WHAT IS IT?    IS IT MY VIBE?        113    00:07:57.433 --> 00:08:02.000    ULTIMATELY, THE ONLY THING THAT    I CAN SAFELY SAY REJECTED NONE        114    00:08:02.000 --> 00:08:05.566    OF US WAS ALSO THE ONLY THING    THAT I CAN SAFELY SAY ALL OF US        115    00:08:05.566 --> 00:08:15.366    WANTED TO BE REJECTED FROM: THE    U.C.'S MAILING LIST.        116    00:08:15.366 --> 00:08:19.066    [ Laughter ]    NOW, I'LL BE HONEST, SOME        117    00:08:19.066 --> 00:08:21.100    FAILURES HURT MORE THAN OTHERS--    THE ONES WHERE WE DID EVERYTHING        118    00:08:21.100 --> 00:08:23.733    RIGHT, PUT IN THE TIME, PUT IN    THE WORK, AND IT STILL DIDN'T        119    00:08:23.733 --> 00:08:30.466    WORK OUT.    FOR INSTANCE, I DEDICATED THE        120    00:08:30.466 --> 00:08:37.633    ENTIRETY OF THE LAST FOUR YEARS    TO ROAMING THE YARD AIMLESSLY IN        121    00:08:37.633 --> 00:08:44.833    HARVARD SWEAT FANTS LANYARD AND    CAY CHAIN WITH AN IMPROBABLE        122    00:08:44.833 --> 00:08:48.633    SMILE ON MY    FACE AND A LARGE DONUT IN EACH        123    00:08:48.633 --> 00:08:49.833    HAND, AND I STILL DIDN'T GET    FEATURED ON DEAN KHURANA'S        124    00:08:49.833 --> 00:09:00.233    INSTAGRAM.    UNTIL YESTERDAY WHEN  RANDOMLY        125    00:09:00.233 --> 00:09:03.900    POSTED ME ON HIS INSTAGRAM.    BUT, I DON'T WANT TO GO TOO HARD        126    00:09:03.900 --> 00:09:05.000    ON YOU, HARVARD.    REMEMBER WHEN WE WERE WRITING        127    00:09:05.000 --> 00:09:07.400    OUR APPLICATIONS, SAYING HOW    BADLY WE WANTED TO BE HERE, HOW        128    00:09:07.400 --> 00:09:10.800    AMAZING WE THOUGHT THIS PLACE    WAS?        129    00:09:10.800 --> 00:09:13.200    IN A WAY, HARVARD IS OUR    LONG-TERM GIRLFRIEND: IN THE        130    00:09:13.200 --> 00:09:15.833    COURTSHIP STAGES, BACK WHEN    NOTHING WAS GUARANTEED, WE TOLD        131    00:09:15.833 --> 00:09:18.800    HARVARD THAT WE "LOVED THE WAY    IT THINKS" AND THAT IT WAS "NOT        132    00:09:18.800 --> 00:09:24.900    LIKE OTHER SCHOOLS"; AND NOW    WE'RE FOUR YEARS IN, LIKE, "AND        133    00:09:24.900 --> 00:09:30.633    WHY DON'T YOU PUT THE TOILET    SEAT BACK UP?"        134    00:09:30.633 --> 00:09:32.333    EXCEPT "PUTTING THE TOILET SEAT    BACK UP" IS ACTUALL"DIVTING        135    00:09:32.333 --> 00:09:36.800    FROM FOSSIL FUELS."    I ALMOST WISH THERE WAS A        136    00:09:36.800 --> 00:09:39.833    PHYSICAL IMAGE TO REPRESENT THAT    DYNAMIC OF GROVELING AT THE        137    00:09:39.833 --> 00:09:42.400    SCHOOL'S FEET WHILE WE WERE    APPLYING AND THEN PROCEEDING TO        138    00:09:42.400 --> 00:09:48.333    URINATE ALL OVER IT, LIKE EAGER    ASPIRING PRE-FROSH RUBBING THE        139    00:09:48.333 --> 00:09:52.133    FOOT OF THE JOHN HARVARD STATUE    FOR GOOD LUCK OR SOMETHING, AND        140    00:09:52.133 --> 00:09:57.733    THEN ACCEPTED STUDENTS-- I DON'T    KNOW-- PEEING ON IT, DRUNK.        141    00:09:57.733 --> 00:10:01.766    OF COURSE, THE GIRLFRIEND    ANALOGY LEAVES OUT A LOT.        142    00:10:01.766 --> 00:10:06.200    NAMELY, THAT HARVARD ALSO PLAYED    SOMETHING OF A PARENTAL ROLE.        143    00:10:06.200 --> 00:10:09.466    OUR FRESHMAN YEAR, THEY DEMANDED    THAT THE YARD BE DRY, NO        144    00:10:09.466 --> 00:10:15.000    ALCOHOL-- WHICH WAS BASICALLY    HARVARD SAYING: "AS LONG AS        145    00:10:15.000 --> 00:10:16.933    YOU'RE UNDER MY ROOF, YOU LIVE    BY MY RULES."        146    00:10:16.933 --> 00:10:21.366    THEN, WE MOVED INTO OUR    UPPERCLASSMEN HOUSES, WHERE WE        147    00:10:21.366 --> 00:10:24.766    HAD DRINKS, PARTIES, AND EVEN    FREE CONDOMS.        148    00:10:24.766 --> 00:10:27.033    AND THAT WAS HARVARD SAYING: "IF    YOU'RE GOING TO DO IT ANYWAY,        149    00:10:27.033 --> 00:10:30.566    I'D RATHER YOU DO IT IN THE    HOUSE."        150    00:10:30.566 --> 00:10:34.033    AND FINALLY, JUST THIS MONTH,    HARVARD REMINDED US NOT TO        151    00:10:34.033 --> 00:10:36.466    COMPLETE THE CELEBRATED    TRADITION OF JUMPING OFF THE        152    00:10:36.466 --> 00:10:39.800    WEEKS BRIDGE FOR OUR OWN SAFETY,    THEREBY BECOMING THE FIRST        153    00:10:39.800 --> 00:10:43.266    PARENTAL FIGURE TO SAY "IF ALL    YOUR FRIENDS JUMPED OFF A        154    00:10:43.266 --> 00:10:47.233    BRIDGE, WOULD YOU JUMP OFF A    BRIDGE, TOO?" AND HAVE "UM,        155    00:10:47.233 --> 00:10:51.800    YEAH?" ACTUALLY BE A REALISTIC    ANSWER.        156    00:10:51.800 --> 00:10:54.400    BUT NOW, HARVARD WON'T BE    PARENTING US ANYMORE.        157    00:10:54.400 --> 00:10:59.366    IT'S TIME FOR THAT INFAMOUS    PLACE, THE "REAL WORLD."        158    00:10:59.366 --> 00:11:03.366    GET READY FOR AN ENDLESS SERIES    OF "YOU WENT TO HARVARD?"        159    00:11:03.366 --> 00:11:06.533    WHICH WILL EITHER MEAN THAT YOU    SAID SOMETHING REALLY STUPID OR        160    00:11:06.533 --> 00:11:14.300    THAT YOU ARE HOT.    [ Laughter ]        161    00:11:14.300 --> 00:11:15.633    THE CLASS OF 2022 WILL GO ON TO    WORK IN ALL SORTS OF FIELDS AND        162    00:11:15.633 --> 00:11:18.533    INDUSTRIES.    SOME OF US WILL BECOME DOCTORS,        163    00:11:18.533 --> 00:11:25.700    TEACHERS, FIREFIGHTERS,    ASTRONAUTS, DETECTIVES, AND ALL        164    00:11:25.700 --> 00:11:31.600    THE OTHER JOBS I TOTALLY KNOW    ABOUT AS A GROWN ADULT.        165    00:11:31.600 --> 00:11:34.700    THOSE OF US WHO SPEND A LITTLE    TOO MUCH TIME ON LINKED IN ARE        166    00:11:34.700 --> 00:11:36.900    GUARANTEED TO BECOME DATA-DRIVEN    THOUGHT LEADERS, PASSIONATE        167    00:11:36.900 --> 00:11:45.266    DOMAIN EXPERTS, OR EVEN CREATIVE    SELF-STARTERS.        168    00:11:45.266 --> 00:11:47.733    AND FINALLY, SOME OF US WILL    ALSO PROBABLY BECOME VILLAINS        169    00:11:47.733 --> 00:11:54.166    BECAUSE THAT'S JUST PLAIN    STATISTICS.        170    00:11:54.166 --> 00:11:55.733    EITHER WAY, OUT THERE IN "THE    REAL WORLD," OUR FIRST CHALLENGE        171    00:11:55.733 --> 00:12:00.033    IS GOING TO BE LEARNING TO SPEAK    NORMALLY AGAIN.        172    00:12:00.033 --> 00:12:02.300    NO MORE ELABORATE ACADEMIC    JARGON, NO MORE WEIRD HARVARD        173    00:12:02.300 --> 00:12:06.833    INSIDE JOKES.    "FETE" WILL NO LONGER BE A        174    00:12:06.833 --> 00:12:09.600    BELOVED ELIOT HOUSE TRADITION    BUT RATHER THE ACRONYM FOR        175    00:12:09.600 --> 00:12:16.100    FEDERAL EXCISE TAX.    "THE BROTHERS" WILL GO BACK TO        176    00:12:16.100 --> 00:12:20.166    BEING A TERM PEOPLE USE TO REFER    TO THEIR ACTUAL MALE SIBLINGS.        177    00:12:20.166 --> 00:12:24.133    AND FINALLY, PERHAPS MOST    DIFFICULT OF ALL, A 15-MINUTE        178    00:12:24.133 --> 00:12:31.500    WALK WILL NO LONGER BE THE    PUNCHLINE TO QUAD-RELATED QUIPS        179    00:12:31.500 --> 00:12:35.966    BUT RATHER A TRULY STANDARD    AMOUNT OF TIME FROM WALKING FROM        180    00:12:35.966 --> 00:12:43.933    ONE PLACE TO ANOTHER.    [APPLAUSE]        181    00:12:43.933 --> 00:12:45.600    NOW, SOME OF YOU MAY BE    THINKING, "BUT YOUMNA, HOW WILL        182    00:12:45.600 --> 00:12:46.866    I SIGNAL TO EVERYONE I MEET OUT    THERE THAT I WENT TO HARVARD IF        183    00:12:46.866 --> 00:12:51.400    I LET GO OF ALL OF THAT?"    WELL, YOU CAN ALWAYS TELL THEM        184    00:12:51.400 --> 00:12:52.633    THAT YOU WENT TO COLLEGE "IN    MASSACHUSETTS" "NEAR BOSTON,"        185    00:12:52.633 --> 00:12:59.866    OR "IN THE BOSTON AREA."    THEY'LL FIGURE IT OUT.        186    00:12:59.866 --> 00:13:02.333    ALL RIGHT, MOST OF WHAT I'VE    SAID DURING THIS SPEECH HAS BEEN        187    00:13:02.333 --> 00:13:04.166    WITH THE GOAL OF GIVING US A    LITTLE LAUGH ON THIS MEMORABLE        188    00:13:04.166 --> 00:13:11.166    DAY.    BUT BEFORE I GO, I WOULD LIKE TO        189    00:13:11.166 --> 00:13:12.966    SHARE WITH MY CLASS MY MAIN    TAKEAWAY FROM HARVARD, WHICH HAS        190    00:13:12.966 --> 00:13:14.733    BEEN THIS: LET'S NOT TAKE LIFE    TOO SERIOUSLY.        191    00:13:14.733 --> 00:13:18.333    LET'S LAUGH AT OURSELVES, AT THE    SUCCESSES AND FAILURES WHICH        192    00:13:18.333 --> 00:13:22.333    WE'LL BE BOUND TO ENCOUNTER.    AND LET'S LAUGH AT INSTITUTIONS,        193    00:13:22.333 --> 00:13:26.166    ESPECIALLY POWERFUL OR    INTIMIDATING ONES LIKE        194    00:13:26.166 --> 00:13:29.900    HARVARD--JUST NOT ACTUAL HARVARD    BECAUSE THEY HAVEN'T TECHNICALLY        195    00:13:29.900 --> 00:13:35.733    GIVEN US OUR DIPLOMAS YET.    AND WITH THAT: CLOSING TIME.        196    00:13:35.733 --> 00:13:39.400    CLASS OF 2022, I AM SO, SO HAPPY        197    00:13:39.400 --> 00:13:41.900    FOR US.    BE PROUD OF THE FOUR YEARS YOU        198    00:13:41.900 --> 00:13:47.366    SPENT HERE REGARDLESS OF WHETHER    YOU'RE GRADUATING CUM LAUDE,        199    00:13:47.366 --> 00:13:53.866    SUMMA CUM LAUDE, IPSO FACTO, OR    PERSONA NON GRATA.        200    00:13:53.866 --> 00:13:58.133    [ Laughter ]    THERE'S A LOT TO BE THANKFUL TO        201    00:13:58.133 --> 00:13:59.933    HARVARD FOR: THE FACULTY WHO    TAUGHT US WITH EMPATHY AND        202    00:13:59.933 --> 00:14:03.200    EXCELLENCE, THE STAFF WHO MADE    US FEEL AT HOME SINCE DAY ONE.        203    00:14:03.200 --> 00:14:04.600    PERHAPS ABOVE ALL, I AM THANKFUL    FOR OUR STUDENT BODY: FROM THE        204    00:14:04.600 --> 00:14:09.000    RECENT ALUMNI WHOM I CAN ONLY    PRESUME ARE IN TEARS AS WE        205    00:14:09.000 --> 00:14:11.700    SPEAK, FLINGING DARTS AT    CARDBOARD CUTOUTS OF THEIR        206    00:14:11.700 --> 00:14:16.700    LANDLORDS; TO THE UNDERCLASSMEN    WHO ARE BASICALLY AT A REALLY        207    00:14:16.700 --> 00:14:20.366    EXPENSIVE SUMMER CAMP; TO US,    THE CLASS OF 2022, WHO ARE IN A        208    00:14:20.366 --> 00:14:25.966    SWEET SPOT THAT WILL LAST    EXACTLY THREE DAYS.        209    00:14:25.966 --> 00:14:29.800    NO MATTER WHAT THE REAL WORLD    WILL BRING, I TRUST THAT WE WILL        210    00:14:29.800 --> 00:14:32.733    MARCH TOWARDS IT WITH KINDNESS,    RESILIENCE, AND COURAGE OF        211    00:14:32.733 --> 00:14:37.800    CONVICTION; WITH LOVE, AN    OPENNESS TO LAUGHTER, AND A        212    00:14:37.800 --> 00:14:42.366    STRONG MORAL COMPASS; AND, ABOVE    ALL, WITH THE HEAVY YET        213    00:14:42.366 --> 00:14:47.233    ULTIMATELY DEEPLY IMPORTANT    KNOWLEDGE THAT SOME OF YOU LOST        214    00:14:47.233 --> 00:14:51.866    YOUR VIRGINITIES IN A BUNK BED.    CONGRATULATIONS, CLASS OF 2022,        215    00:14:51.866 --> 00:14:59.233    AND THANK YOU SO MUCH!    [CHEERING AND APPLAUSE]

title: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu Address | Harvard Class Day 2022
desc: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu â€™07 addressed the Harvard College Class of 2022 at the schoolâ€™s Class Day ceremony.
speech_raw: 1    00:00:01.466 --> 00:00:05.900    THANK YOU BOTH SO MUCH.    THANK YOU FOR THAT VERY        2    00:00:05.900 --> 00:00:08.800    GENEROUS, KIND INTRODUCTION.    IT FEELS LIKE THERE'S SORT OF A        3    00:00:08.800 --> 00:00:12.733    TRANSFORMATIVE EXPERIENCE    BINGO CARD OUT THERE, I'LL TRY        4    00:00:12.733 --> 00:00:15.900    TO WEAVE THAT IN AS WELL.    THANK YOU YOUMNA FOR        5    00:00:15.900 --> 00:00:20.066    SAVING ME. I FORGOT MY PREPARED    REMARKS TODAY AND INSTEAD        6    00:00:20.066 --> 00:00:26.600    GRABBED ACCIDENTALLY MY SIX PAGE    HAIR CARE MANUAL.        7    00:00:26.600 --> 00:00:33.566    PERFECT HUMIDITY LEVEL TODAY.    THANK YOU SO MUCH CLASS        8    00:00:33.566 --> 00:00:36.900    COMMITTEE, CLASS OF 2022 FOR    INVITING ME TO JOIN YOU FOR THIS        9    00:00:36.900 --> 00:00:41.200    TREMENDOUS HONOR.    WHEN I GOT THE INVITATION TO BE        10    00:00:41.200 --> 00:00:46.466    YOUR SPEAKER, I FELT A PANG OF    RECOGNITION, FOR MY EARLIEST        11    00:00:46.466 --> 00:00:50.900    DAYS HERE IN THE YARD, LOOKING    AROUND, AND WONDERING HOW I        12    00:00:50.900 --> 00:00:56.666    COULD POSSIBLY BELONG HERE.    I DIDN'T KNOW ANYTHING ABOUT        13    00:00:56.666 --> 00:01:00.900    POLITICS.    WASN'T A JUNIOR SQUASH CHAMPION,        14    00:01:00.900 --> 00:01:06.733    HADN'T WRITTEN A BOOK ON    ASTRONOMY, THOSE WERE ALL MY        15    00:01:06.733 --> 00:01:09.500    ENTRY WAY MATES.    AND JUST LIKE THEN WHEN I WAS        16    00:01:09.500 --> 00:01:13.200    FIRST ASKED TO JOIN YOU TODAY    WAS, WHAT MAKES ME QUALIFIED        17    00:01:13.200 --> 00:01:17.900    JUST SIX MONTHS INTO MY NEW JOB    FOR THIS INCREDIBILITY HONOR.        18    00:01:17.900 --> 00:01:21.666    I'M STILL TERRIBLE AT SQUASH.    MY SECOND THOUGHT WAS, ACTUALLY        19    00:01:21.666 --> 00:01:25.466    THIS IS KIND OF AWKWARD BECAUSE    I HAD ALREADY TOLD ONE OF THE        20    00:01:25.466 --> 00:01:27.866    HARVARD GRAD SCHOOLS THAT I    WASN'T AVAILABLE TO BE THEIR        21    00:01:27.866 --> 00:01:34.000    GRADUATION SPEAKER!    TRUE STORY!        22    00:01:34.000 --> 00:01:37.066    BUT I WANTED TO BE HERE WITH YOU    ALL BECAUSE THIS IS TRULY ONE OF        23    00:01:37.066 --> 00:01:40.733    THE MOST SPECIAL EVENTS FROM    COMMENCEMENT WEEK.        24    00:01:40.733 --> 00:01:44.666    IT'S INCREDIBLE OPPORTUNITY TO    SPEAK WITH ALL OF YOU IN THIS        25    00:01:44.666 --> 00:01:47.600    MOMENT.    IT'S A MOMENT OF POSSIBILITY.        26    00:01:47.600 --> 00:01:51.633    AS YOU REFLECT ON ALL THAT YOU    HAVE BEEN IMMERSED IN, IN PERSON        27    00:01:51.633 --> 00:01:57.933    AND OVER ZOOM OVER THE LAST FEW    YEARS WITH THOSE WHO HAVE GROWN        28    00:01:57.933 --> 00:02:01.366    ALONGSIDE YOU.    SIX MONTHS AGO I WAS SWORN IN AS        29    00:02:01.366 --> 00:02:06.200    AN UNUSUAL MAYOR OF BOSTON.    THERE'S NOT MUCH AROUND THAT IS        30    00:02:06.200 --> 00:02:09.000    OLDER THAN HARVARD, BUT BOSTON        31    00:02:09.000 --> 00:02:11.500    IS.    FOUNDED IN 1630 AND UNTIL SIX        32    00:02:11.500 --> 00:02:17.466    MONTHS AGO, WE HAD NEVER IN    NEARLY 400 YEARS ELECTED A WOMAN        33    00:02:17.466 --> 00:02:26.066    OR A PERSON OF COLOR AS MAYOR!    [APPLAUSE]        34    00:02:26.066 --> 00:02:31.766    >> AND IT HAD BEEN NEARLY A    CENTURY SINCE A HARVARD COLLEGE        35    00:02:31.766 --> 00:02:36.233    GRAD BECAME MAYOR OF BOSTON.    BUT 15 YEARS AGO, I SAT IN YOUR        36    00:02:36.233 --> 00:02:39.333    VERY SEATS.    SO MAYBE WHAT QUALIFIES ME MOST        37    00:02:39.333 --> 00:02:43.966    OF ALL TO SHARE SOME INSIGHTS AT    CLASS DAY IS THAT I'M PROOF THAT        38    00:02:43.966 --> 00:02:47.333    YOU CAN GO FROM HAVING    ABSOLUTELY NO IDEA WHAT YOU WANT        39    00:02:47.333 --> 00:02:54.266    TO DO AT CLASS DAY TO MAYOR OF    THE GREATEST CITY ON THE PLANET!        40    00:02:54.266 --> 00:03:00.533    [CHEERING AND APPLAUSE]    >> SINCE IT'S ONLY BEEN 15        41    00:03:00.533 --> 00:03:04.200    YEARS, I CAN ALSO TELL YOU THAT    YOU LIKELY WON'T REMEMBER        42    00:03:04.200 --> 00:03:09.966    ANYTHING FROM THESE SPEECHES.    EXCEPT FOR ASTRONOMY RESEARCHERS        43    00:03:09.966 --> 00:03:12.100    OUT THERE, YOU SEEM TO REMEMBER    EVERYTHING.        44    00:03:12.100 --> 00:03:15.233    BUT IF THERE IS ONE WORD YOU    MIGHT HOLD ONTO FROM YOUR TIME        45    00:03:15.233 --> 00:03:17.725    HERE, LET IT BE THE WORD THAT'S     ON YOUR SHINY CLASS RINGS        46    00:03:17.725 --> 00:03:22.618    ON THE SWEATSHIRTS YOU'LL RETURN TO    FOR COMFORT AND COZINESS,        47    00:03:22.618 --> 00:03:25.583    THE HATS YOU'VE BEEN HASTILY    GIVING TO FAMILY MEMBERS AS YOU          48    00:03:25.583 --> 00:03:28.880    DASH HOME FOR THE HOLIDAYS FROM THE COOP.        49    00:03:28.880 --> 00:03:37.096    VERITAS SO LET'S GO WITH THAT.    MY TRUTH IS, I CAME TO HARVARD        50    00:03:37.096 --> 00:03:47.733    FOR THE CLAM CHOWDER, I HAD NO    GRAND CAREER PLANS OR EVEN A        51    00:03:47.733 --> 00:03:54.266    CLEAR ACADEMIC PASSION BUT I DID    HAVE A LOT OF CLAM CHOWDER AT        52    00:03:54.266 --> 00:04:00.466    ANENBERG.    I'M THE OLDEST CHILD OF IMMIGRANT        53    00:04:00.466 --> 00:04:04.966    PARENTS FROM TAIWAN.    WE PILE INTO THE MINI VAN AND        54    00:04:04.966 --> 00:04:08.733    DRIVE OVER AN HOUR TO GET TO THE    CHINESE GROCERY STORE THAT HAD        55    00:04:08.733 --> 00:04:12.600    THE RIGHT VEGETABLES AND SPICES.    BUT IN THE RARE INSTANCES WHEN        56    00:04:12.600 --> 00:04:18.133    WE DID GO OUT FOR DINNER MY    PARENTS WOULD INSIST ON OLD        57    00:04:18.133 --> 00:04:22.366    COUNTRY BUFFET, IT'S BEFORE YOUR    TIME NOW BUT THERE USED TO BE IN        58    00:04:22.366 --> 00:04:27.766    VARIOUS SUBURBAN STRIP MALLS AND    ALL YOU CAN EAT BUFFET, OF        59    00:04:27.766 --> 00:04:31.766    THINGS YOU WANTED LIKE MAC AND    CHEESE AND ROAST BEEF.        60    00:04:31.766 --> 00:04:38.100    THEY CHARGED KIDS BY THEIR AGE    WHICH TOOK FUN OUT OF THE        61    00:04:38.100 --> 00:04:41.433    BIRTHDAYS.    BUT THE HIGHLIGHTS OF THE MEAL        62    00:04:41.433 --> 00:04:51.233    WAS AFTER THE MEAL I WOULD STILL    FIND ROOM FOR SOFT SERVE ICE        63    00:04:51.233 --> 00:04:55.100    CREAM AND A GLORIOUS BOWL OF CLAM CHOWDER.    WHEN I LEARNED THERE WAS ALWAYS        64    00:04:55.100 --> 00:05:02.833    SOFT SERVE ICE CREAM IN THE DINING    HALLS AND CLAM CHOWDER, THAT WAS        65    00:05:02.833 --> 00:05:07.366    IT.    TO THIS DAY I'M STILL CURRIER        66    00:05:07.366 --> 00:05:11.766    HOUSE THROUGH AND THROUGH.    MY TRUTH IS THAT I WAS        67    00:05:11.766 --> 00:05:15.133    DISAPPOINTED ABOUT GETTING    QUADDED AND CONFUSED WHY OUR        68    00:05:15.133 --> 00:05:22.400    MASCOT WAS A TREE AND OTHERS HAD    ANIMALS THAT WERE FEARS AND        69    00:05:22.400 --> 00:05:29.700    REGAL OR AT LEAST CUTE.    I'M UP TO PLANTING TREES IN        70    00:05:29.700 --> 00:05:36.766    BOSTON TO CREATE THE URBAN HEAT    EFFECT, AN ON SE DAYS I BLURT        71    00:05:36.766 --> 00:05:41.633    OUT, "FEAR THE TREE!"    [APPLAUSE]        72    00:05:41.633 --> 00:05:46.666    >> HERE'S ANOTHER TRUTH.    I MET MY FUTURE HUSBAND AT        73    00:05:46.666 --> 00:05:51.366    HARVARD YALE AND THE TRUTH IS HE    WENT TO YALE!        74    00:05:51.366 --> 00:05:54.166    LOVE KNOWS NO BOUNDS EXCEPT FOR        75    00:05:54.166 --> 00:05:56.233    ONE.    WE STILL HAVE NEVER SAT ON THE        76    00:05:56.233 --> 00:06:02.800    SAME SIDE AT THE GAME.    AND THE TRUTH IS, AT MY        77    00:06:02.800 --> 00:06:04.966    COMMENCEMENT I WAS SCARED.        78    00:06:04.966 --> 00:06:07.666    SURE.    THERE WAS THAT SLIGHT NERVESNESS        79    00:06:07.666 --> 00:06:11.133    ABOUT ENTERING THE REAL WORLD.    BUT IT WAS MORE THAN THAT.        80    00:06:11.133 --> 00:06:16.766    A TOOU MONTHS EARLIER, MY MOM --    A FEW IS MONTHS EARLIER MY MOM        81    00:06:16.766 --> 00:06:22.100    HAD STARTED TO SHOW THE SIGNS OF    MENTAL ILLNESS, PAIR 90 A,        82    00:06:22.100 --> 00:06:23.633    DILUTIONS, HEARING THINGS NO ONE    ELSE COULD HEAR.        83    00:06:23.633 --> 00:06:27.433    IN THE CULTURE I GREW UP IN.    WE COULDN'T BRING OUR BUSINESS        84    00:06:27.433 --> 00:06:30.133    OUT TO THE PUBLIC.    I COULDN'T TALK ABOUT IT OUTSIDE        85    00:06:30.133 --> 00:06:34.700    IF FAMILY, AND MY MOM REFUSED TO    ACKNOWLEDGE WHAT WAS HAPPENING        86    00:06:34.700 --> 00:06:36.433    MUCH LESS AGREE TO SEEK    TREATMENT.        87    00:06:36.433 --> 00:06:40.533    MY COMMENCEMENT WAS ONE OF THE    LAST PUBLIC EVENTS SHE ATTENDED        88    00:06:40.533 --> 00:06:44.666    BEFORE A MAJOR BREAKDOWN.    AND I WAS SO WORRIED ABOUT HER,        89    00:06:44.666 --> 00:06:50.300    AND ABOUT MY FRIENDS AND THEIR    FAMILIES NOTICING HER STRANGE        90    00:06:50.300 --> 00:06:54.966    BEHAVIOR, IT STILL TOOK MONTHS    AFTER THAT FOR US TO GET HER TO        91    00:06:54.966 --> 00:06:58.500    SEEK TREATMENT AND MONTHS AFTER    THAT FOR ME TO BE ABLE TO TALK        92    00:06:58.500 --> 00:07:04.933    ABOUT IT WITH MY FRIENDS.    IT WAS STILL A TRUTH THAT WAS        93    00:07:04.933 --> 00:07:07.700    TOO PAINFUL TO SHARE BECAUSE OF    THE STIG PLA THAT WE MUST ALL BE        94    00:07:07.700 --> 00:07:14.466    A PART OF BREAK.    THE TRUTH IS AMONG MY BLOCK IN        95    00:07:14.466 --> 00:07:18.000    GROUP I WAS THE LAST PERSON    ANYONE THOUGHT WOULD END UP IN        96    00:07:18.000 --> 00:07:23.800    POLITICS BUT MY FAMILY'S    CHALLENGES, MY MOM'S JOIN WITH        97    00:07:23.800 --> 00:07:25.800    MENTAL HEALTH SET ME ON THIS    PATH.        98    00:07:25.800 --> 00:07:30.200    STEPPING IN AS A CAREGIVER TO MY    MOM, RAISING MY SISTERS SHORTLY        99    00:07:30.200 --> 00:07:33.400    AFTER GRADUATION, OPENING A    SMALL BUSINESS, AND SEEING HOW        100    00:07:33.400 --> 00:07:38.700    SO MANY OF THE SYSTEMS WE HAD TO    INTERACT WITH, WEREN'T DESIGNED        101    00:07:38.700 --> 00:07:43.633    FOR PEOPLE LIKE MY FAMILY.    AND ALSO, SEEING THAT WE CAN ALL        102    00:07:43.633 --> 00:07:49.333    HAVE A ROLE IN FIXING THEM.    YOLL HR THE WISE, WORLDLY        103    00:07:49.333 --> 00:07:53.133    ADVICE TOMORROW AT COMMENCEMENT    MORNING EXERCISES SO I'LL JUST        104    00:07:53.133 --> 00:07:57.000    GIVE THREE THINGS THAT I'VE    LEARNED ABOUT VERITAS IN THE        105    00:07:57.000 --> 00:08:02.133    YEARS SINCE LEAVING THE YARD.    FIRST, YOUR OWN DEEP TRUTH SETS        106    00:08:02.133 --> 00:08:05.466    THE FOUNDATION FOR YOUR    HAPPINESS HEALTH AND IMPACT.        107    00:08:05.466 --> 00:08:08.400    TAKE CARE OF YOURSELF.    FIGURE OUT WHAT GETS YOU EXCITED        108    00:08:08.400 --> 00:08:11.666    TO WAKE UP IN THE MORNING AND    JUST AS IMPORTANT, LISTEN TO        109    00:08:11.666 --> 00:08:15.866    YOUR BODY AND KNOW WHEN IT'S    TELLING YOU YOU'RE NOT OKAY.        110    00:08:15.866 --> 00:08:19.666    SURROUND YOURSELF WITH FRIENDS.    IMMERSE YOURSELF IN THE WORK        111    00:08:19.666 --> 00:08:22.800    THAT RESPECTS UR TRUTH.    THAT NEEDS IT.        112    00:08:22.800 --> 00:08:27.633    AND NURTURES IT.    AND ENCOURAGES YOU TO BE THE        113    00:08:27.633 --> 00:08:30.166    TRUEST AND MOST JOYFUL VERSION    OF YOURSELF.        114    00:08:30.166 --> 00:08:34.800    I NEED SOME QUIET TIME BY MYSELF    AT THE END OF EACH DAY WITH TWO        115    00:08:34.800 --> 00:08:38.333    KIDS THAT IS QUITE DIFFICULT.    AND EVERY ONCE THAT WHILE I NEED        116    00:08:38.333 --> 00:08:42.033    A HIKE IN THE WOODS.    FEAR THE TREE!        117    00:08:42.033 --> 00:08:46.300    I FIND MY GREATEST MEANING IN    BUILDING COMMUNITY AND HELPING        118    00:08:46.300 --> 00:08:49.933    CHANGE PEOPLE'S PERSPECTIVES ON    WHAT'S POSSIBLE.        119    00:08:49.933 --> 00:08:55.366    SECOND, SEE WHAT IS TRULY REAL.    THERE IS NO SUBSTITUTFOR LIVED        120    00:08:55.366 --> 00:08:57.433    EXPERIENCE.    SURE, YOU CAN GOGGLE ALMOST        121    00:08:57.433 --> 00:09:02.100    ANYTHING NOW.    OR WATCH A TIKTOK EXPLAINER        122    00:09:02.100 --> 00:09:04.966    VIDEO BUT IF YOU ARE TRYING TO    SOLVE A PROBLEM IN THE WORLD        123    00:09:04.966 --> 00:09:06.333    UNDERSTAND WHAT IT PEOPLES LIKE        124    00:09:06.333 --> 00:09:08.933    FIRST.    SEEK OUT THOSE CLOSE TO THE        125    00:09:08.933 --> 00:09:11.933    CHALLENGE AND THOSE THAT WILL BE    MOST IMPACTED BY ITS SOLUTION.        126    00:09:11.933 --> 00:09:17.166    I TAKE THE T TO WORK BECAUSE MY    OWN DEEP TRUTH IS THAT I'M A        127    00:09:17.166 --> 00:09:19.433    TRANSIT NERD.    BUT ALSO BECAUSE THERE'S NO        128    00:09:19.433 --> 00:09:24.266    BETTER WAY TO GET EXPERTISE IN    TRANSIT POLICY THAN TO        129    00:09:24.266 --> 00:09:27.300    EXPERIENCE THE SYSTEM YOU'RE    TRYING TO IMPROVE DAY IN AND DAY        130    00:09:27.300 --> 00:09:30.300    OUT.    THERE WILL ALWAYS BE PEOPLE WHO        131    00:09:30.300 --> 00:09:33.466    KNOW MORE ABOUT PEOPLE ABOUT A    CHALLENGE OR A SOLUTION.        132    00:09:33.466 --> 00:09:37.266    SEEK THEM OUT AND ASK QUESTIONS.    SOME MIGHT BE SITTING RIGHT NEXT        133    00:09:37.266 --> 00:09:40.966    TO YOU HERE TODAY.    AND MANY ARE IN OUR        134    00:09:40.966 --> 00:09:43.700    NEIGHBORHOODS AND COMMUNITY    ORGANIZATIONS, DOING THE WORK ON        135    00:09:43.700 --> 00:09:47.666    THE GROUND.    THIRD:  TELL THE TRUTH WHEN IT'S        136    00:09:47.666 --> 00:09:51.333    HARD.    I'M NOT JUST TALKING ABOUT        137    00:09:51.333 --> 00:09:56.000    ADMITTING TO A DEEP LOVE FOR    CLAM CHOWDER OR EVEN WORKING TO        138    00:09:56.000 --> 00:09:59.600    BREAK THE STIG PLA ON MENTAL ILL    OWNERS BRING SHARING OUR        139    00:09:59.600 --> 00:10:03.733    STORIES.    IN THIS AGEOF INFORMATION,        140    00:10:03.733 --> 00:10:08.200    OVERLOAD AND MISINFORMATION,    CURATED SOCIAL MEDIA FEEDS THAT        141    00:10:08.200 --> 00:10:10.666    TOUT CONNECTION OFTEN DRIVE US    FURTHER AND FURTHER APART.        142    00:10:10.666 --> 00:10:15.733    IN POLITICS AND IN FAMILY AND IN    WORK, SPEAK YOUR TRUTH AND HOLD        143    00:10:15.733 --> 00:10:20.266    TRUE TO THE URGENCY YOU FEEL.    BECAUSE FUNDAMENTALLY, SPEAKING        144    00:10:20.266 --> 00:10:23.766    TRUTH IS THE ONLY WAY TO BUILD A    FOUNDATION FOR TRUST.        145    00:10:23.766 --> 00:10:27.733    AND THAT IS WHAT WE ARE MISSING    IN OUR SOCIETY AND OUR DEMOCRACY        146    00:10:27.733 --> 00:10:34.433    TODAY.    YOU KNOW ALL THE FACTS AND        147    00:10:34.433 --> 00:10:39.033    STATISTICS ON CLIMATE RISKS,    HOUSING AND CHILDCARE COSTS, OUR        148    00:10:39.033 --> 00:10:42.766    CLOSING WINDOW OF TIME TO ACT.    YET FROM PANDEMIC, PUBLIC HEALTH        149    00:10:42.766 --> 00:10:47.000    TO STUDENT LOAN DEBT, BASIC    REPRODUCTIVE RIGHTS AND GUN        150    00:10:47.000 --> 00:10:50.233    VIOLENCE WE'RE HAVING TO FIGHT    THROUGH A TIDAL WAVE IN THIS        151    00:10:50.233 --> 00:10:54.166    COUNTRY OF MISINFORMATION,    BEFORE WE EVEN TREECH BARRIER OF        152    00:10:54.166 --> 00:10:58.300    PROVING THAT OUR POLICY    SOLUTIONS WORK.        153    00:10:58.300 --> 00:11:03.033    TO TACKLE THE CHALLENGES THAT WE    FACE TODAY WE NEED TO BUILD        154    00:11:03.033 --> 00:11:05.333    TRUST IN THE URGENCY OF OUR    CHALLENGES BY SEEKING THE TRUTH        155    00:11:05.333 --> 00:11:07.633    OF THE EXPERIENCES OF THOSE ON    THE GROUND.        156    00:11:07.633 --> 00:11:09.966    SPEAKING THE TRUTH WHEN IT'S    HARD AND BUILDING THE COMMUNITY        157    00:11:09.966 --> 00:11:15.500    TO SOLVE IT.    WE MUST TRUST IN POSSIBILITY.        158    00:11:15.500 --> 00:11:21.200    INCLUDING THE POSSIBILITY TO DO    THE THINGS THAT SEEM IMPOSSIBLE.        159    00:11:21.200 --> 00:11:25.300    THAT PEOPLE SAY ARE TOO PIE IN    THE SKY OR RADICAL TO BE DONE.        160    00:11:25.300 --> 00:11:29.333    AND BOSTON IS A CITY WHOSE    HISTORY IS ROOTED IN DOING JUST        161    00:11:29.333 --> 00:11:32.633    THAT.    TIME AND TIME AGAIN.        162    00:11:32.633 --> 00:11:35.633    TODAY WE'RE PROUD OF OUR MANY    FIRSTS.        163    00:11:35.633 --> 00:11:41.166    BOSTON IS LOAM TO THE FIRST    PUBLIC LIBRARY IN THE COUNTRY,        164    00:11:41.166 --> 00:11:44.466    FIRST PUBLIC PARK, FIRST PUBLIC    SCHOOL, FIRST SUBWAY SYSTEM        165    00:11:44.466 --> 00:11:48.400    ANYWHERE IN THE UNITED STATES.    BUT WHAT WE OFTEN FORGET IS THAT        166    00:11:48.400 --> 00:11:52.366    THE OPPOSITION TO THESE    FOUNDATIONAL PUBLIC GOODS THAT        167    00:11:52.366 --> 00:12:04.400    WE DON'T GIVE A SECOND THOUGHT    TO TODAY, WAS ONCE F FIERCE AND        168    00:12:04.400 --> 00:12:07.100    IMAGINATIVE IN ALL THE WRONG        169    00:12:07.100 --> 00:12:09.000    WAYS.    BEFORE THE FIRST SUBWAY LINE IN        170    00:12:09.000 --> 00:12:15.700    THE COUNTRY BUSINESS OWNERS    ALONG TMONT STREET FORMED THE        171    00:12:15.700 --> 00:12:21.700    ANTISUBWAY LEAGUE, TO OPPOSE THE    CREATION OF ANY SUBWAY LINES        172    00:12:21.700 --> 00:12:24.633    ANYWHERE IN THE CITY OF BOSTON.    THEY CREATED TENS OF THOUSANDS        173    00:12:24.633 --> 00:12:27.566    OF SIXTHS FROM BUSINESS OWNERS    AND RESIDENTS WHO WERE AFRAID.        174    00:12:27.566 --> 00:12:34.000    THEY WERE AFRAID OF EVERYTHING    FROM BRINGING A CURSE ON THE        175    00:12:34.000 --> 00:12:38.166    CITY FOR WHAT MIGHT BE    UNDERGROUND, DIGGING UP        176    00:12:38.166 --> 00:12:41.066    EXTENSIVE SWATHS OF THE GROUND    AND POTENTIALLY FORCING SNAKES        177    00:12:41.066 --> 00:12:43.833    LIVING UNDER THE EARTH TO TAKE    OVER THE SURFACE AND THEN TAKE        178    00:12:43.833 --> 00:12:47.833    OVER ALL OF BOSTON.    THESE WERE ACTUALLY IN THE        179    00:12:47.833 --> 00:12:49.933    DOCUMENTS IN THE BOSTON    ARCHIVES.        180    00:12:49.933 --> 00:12:51.700    AND TODAY, WE DEPEND ON THIS        181    00:12:51.700 --> 00:12:54.833    SYSTEM.    WE'RE LEADING THE WAY IN PUBLIC        182    00:12:54.833 --> 00:12:59.666    TRANSPORTATION'S VISION FOR A    FAIR, FREE SYSTEM, THAT SERVES        183    00:12:59.666 --> 00:13:05.100    ALL.    SO TO BE BOLD, AND CREATIVE,        184    00:13:05.100 --> 00:13:07.533    HARVEST YOUR IMAGINATION TO    FOCUS ON THE GOOD WE CAN DO WHEN        185    00:13:07.533 --> 00:13:12.233    WE WORK TOGETHER.    AND LET'S LET GO OF OUR        186    00:13:12.233 --> 00:13:15.700    INSTINCTS TO PROTECT THE STATUS    QUO.        187    00:13:15.700 --> 00:13:24.166    AND HARNESS YOUR LEADERSHIP AND    CAR I MA AND KNOWLEDGE, IF WE        188    00:13:24.166 --> 00:13:29.833    AGREE TO GET OUR HANDS DIRTY AND    BREAKER GROUND, RATHER THAN        189    00:13:29.833 --> 00:13:34.100    WORRYING WHAT SNAKES MIKE LURK    BENEATH THE SURFACE.        190    00:13:34.100 --> 00:13:40.666    MOST OF ALL, REMEMBER, I ENDED    UP AS THE GREEN NEW DEAL MAYOR        191    00:13:40.666 --> 00:13:50.433    OF BOSTON DUE TO A LOVE OF CLAM    CHOWDER, A REVERENCE FOR TREES,        192    00:13:50.433 --> 00:13:55.600    FIND THE PLACE WITHIN THAT SPACE    AND CAN YOU BE YOUR TRUEST SELF        193    00:13:55.600 --> 00:13:58.766    AND IF IT DOESN'T EXIST, BUILD    IT.        194    00:13:58.766 --> 00:14:02.233    I KNOW BETTER THAN TO TRY TO    TELL YOU NOT TO DO IT ALL.        195    00:14:02.233 --> 00:14:06.300    BUT I WILL ENCOURAGE YOU TO FIND    THE TIME EVERY NOW AND THEN TO        196    00:14:06.300 --> 00:14:09.000    JUST BE.    LIE IN THE SUN.        197    00:14:09.000 --> 00:14:13.033    HUG YOUR FRIENDS.    FACETIME YOUR FAMILY AND PICK UP        198    00:14:13.033 --> 00:14:17.300    THEIR PHONE CALLS.    READ A FEW PAGES OF A BOOK.        199    00:14:17.300 --> 00:14:20.400    TAKE CARE OF YOURSELF AND    EVERYONE YOU CARE FOR THEREAFTER        200    00:14:20.400 --> 00:14:24.333    WILL BE GRATEFUL THAT DID YOU.    AND WHEN YOU'RE READY -- THAT        201    00:14:24.333 --> 00:14:27.833    YOU DID.    AND WHEN YOU'RE READY SEEK THE        202    00:14:27.833 --> 00:14:30.366    TRUTH, SEE WHAT'S REAL WHAT'S    NECESSARY AND WHAT'S NOT.        203    00:14:30.366 --> 00:14:33.433    THINK ABOUT THE IMPACT    ESPECIALLY FOR THOSE NEAREST        204    00:14:33.433 --> 00:14:36.600    WHATEVER ISSUE YOU'RE TRYING TO    SOLVE BUT NOT AT THE EXPENSE OF        205    00:14:36.600 --> 00:14:41.533    THOSE ON THE PERIPHERY.    AND WHEN YOU FIND THAT TRUTH,        206    00:14:41.533 --> 00:14:45.966    SWIM THROUGH WAVES OF    MISINFORMATION AND DISBELIEF,        207    00:14:45.966 --> 00:14:49.966    AND INCREDULOUSNESS AND TELL IT,    TELL THE TRUTH WHEN IT'S HARD        208    00:14:49.966 --> 00:14:54.033    AND UNCOMFORTABLE AND COMPLEX.    AND TO THE EXTENT THAT YOU CAN,        209    00:14:54.033 --> 00:14:58.800    HOLD PEOPLE THROUGH IT, IF THEY    NEED TO BE HELD, BUT TELL THE        210    00:14:58.800 --> 00:15:01.366    TRUTH.    TELL IT SO WE CAN BUILD AND        211    00:15:01.366 --> 00:15:04.866    REBUILD THE TRUST THAT'S NEEDED    FOR OUR BRIGHTEST FUTURE.        212    00:15:04.866 --> 00:15:10.533    YOU CAN DO ANYTHING.    CHOOSE TO MAKE WHAT YOU DO        213    00:15:10.533 --> 00:15:15.666    IMPACTFUL, JOYFUL, AND TRUE.    FOR ALL ROOTING FOR YOU CLASS OF        214    00:15:15.666 --> 00:15:20.933    2022.    CONGRATULATIONS AND GOOD LUCK.

title: Latin Salutatory | Harvard Commencement 2022
desc: Graduate Benjamin Porteous '22 delivered the Latin Salutatory at Harvard's 2022 Commencement Exercises.
speech_raw: 1    00:00:00.700 --> 00:00:07.540    PRESIDENT BACOW, DEANS, MOST        2    00:00:07.540 --> 00:00:13.279    LEARNED PROFESSORS,    THRICE-HONORED GUESTS.        3    00:00:13.279 --> 00:00:21.554    ESTEEMED ALUMNI AND ALUMNAE,    FAMILIES WHO HAVE ENDURED SO        4    00:00:21.554 --> 00:00:30.296    MUCH ON OUR BEHALF    AND ESPECIALLY, YOU, MY MOST        5    00:00:30.296 --> 00:00:45.512    BELOVED CLASSMATES: GREETINGS!    (CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)        6    00:00:45.512 --> 00:00:54.187    I HAVE CLIMBED THESE STEPS    TODAY, CLASSMATES.        7    00:00:54.187 --> 00:01:06.299    TO TELL YOU HOW WONDERFUL JOHN    MARTIN OF ANNENBERG IS.        8    00:01:06.299 --> 00:01:14.240    WHEN WE FIRST ARRIVED IN THIS    HARVARD YARD OF OURS        9    00:01:14.240 --> 00:01:18.278    IT WAS WITH GREAT TREPIDATION    THAT WE OPENED THOSE FORMIDABLE        10    00:01:18.278 --> 00:01:27.554    DOORS OF ANNENBERG.    HOW FORTUNATE WERE THOSE WHO        11    00:01:27.554 --> 00:01:33.593    APPROACHED THE DOORS WITH    COMPANIONS-- ROOMMATES        12    00:01:33.593 --> 00:01:41.768    PERHAPS--    OR ELSE FRIENDS THEY HAD MET ON        13    00:01:41.768 --> 00:01:57.650    THE FACEBOOK PAGE OF THE HARVARD    COLLEGE CLASS OF 2022!        14    00:01:57.650 --> 00:02:03.490    (CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)    HAD TO ENTER ANNENBERG ALL        15    00:02:03.490 --> 00:02:18.271    ALONE.    HOWEVER, PASSING OVER THE        16    00:02:18.271 --> 00:02:21.574    THRESHOLD, WE ENCOUNTERED THAT    MOST EXCELLENT CITIZEN OF THIS        17    00:02:21.574 --> 00:02:25.178    UNIVERSITY    GREATEST OF CARD-SWIPERS, BEST        18    00:02:25.178 --> 00:02:36.756    FRIEND OF FIRST-YEARS, THE    ONE-AND-ONLY JOHN!        19    00:02:36.756 --> 00:02:39.492    HE, ENDOWED WITH A REMARKABLE    FACULTY OF MEMORY, HAD LEARNED        20    00:02:39.492 --> 00:02:46.266    BEFORE THE MIDDLE OF SEPTEMBER    NOT ONLY OUR NAMES, BUT ALSO THE        21    00:02:46.266 --> 00:02:56.442    NAMES OF OUR FAVORITE SPORTS    TEAMS        22    00:02:56.442 --> 00:03:01.915    OF OUR PARENTS AND SIBLINGS, AND    EVEN OF OUR CATS AND DOGS.        23    00:03:01.915 --> 00:03:02.982    EVERY DAY HE WELCOMED US INTO    THE DINING HALL WITH AN        24    00:03:02.982 --> 00:03:14.294    ENTHUSIASTIC GREETING AND    CHEERFUL BANTER.        25    00:03:14.294 --> 00:03:16.829    IN MY HEART THIS    IS THE SOUND-- AND HOW SWEET IT        26    00:03:16.829 --> 00:03:30.210    IS-- OF OUR FIRST YEAR AT    HARVARD COLLEGE:        27    00:03:30.210 --> 00:03:38.218    THUS, SWIPE.    "ANA LUIZA!        28    00:03:38.218 --> 00:03:45.458    HOW IS YOUR MOTHER DOING?    IT GETS REALLY COLD IN MONTREAL        29    00:03:45.458 --> 00:03:50.230    IN THE WINTER.    BE SURE TO REMIND HER TO DRESS        30    00:03:50.230 --> 00:03:52.232    WARMLY!"        31    00:03:52.232 --> 00:03:57.470    SWIPE.    "GREETINGS, KING PHILIP!"        32    00:03:57.470 --> 00:04:01.441    "MINJUE, GOOD LUCK WITH YOUR    P-SET!"        33    00:04:01.441 --> 00:04:01.841    SWIPE. "JAKE!        34    00:04:01.841 --> 00:04:06.980    HOW... OH!    EXCUSE ME A SEC!        35    00:04:06.980 --> 00:04:11.884    HEY! YOU THERE! NO TOURISTS    ALLOWED IN HERE!        36    00:04:11.884 --> 00:04:15.121    NO, TOURISTS AREN'T ALLOWED TO    TAKE PHOTOGRAPHS IN HERE EITHER.        37    00:04:15.121 --> 00:04:20.493    DIDN'T YOU SEE THE SIGN?    IT'S WRITTEN IN SIX LANGUAGES.        38    00:04:20.493 --> 00:04:25.832    HMM, WHAT WAS I SAYING?    AH," SWIPE.        39    00:04:25.832 --> 00:04:27.433    "OCTAVIO!    I HEARD THE CUBS WON YESTERDAY        40    00:04:27.433 --> 00:04:30.870    AND I WAS SO HAPPY FOR YOU."        41    00:04:30.870 --> 00:04:32.238    SWIPE.    "BEN, WHAT ARE YOU UP TO?        42    00:04:32.238 --> 00:04:33.506    YOU AREN'T CARRYING THE WHOLE    LIBRARY IN YOUR BACKPACK ARE        43    00:04:33.506 --> 00:04:42.248    YOU?"    THEN THE DETESTABLE PANDEMIC        44    00:04:42.248 --> 00:04:46.185    CAME UPON US.    IT DROVE US OUT OF THIS        45    00:04:46.185 --> 00:04:52.025    UNIVERSITY WE LOVE.    IT STRUCK THE VERY WORLD WITH        46    00:04:52.025 --> 00:05:02.235    ITS DREAD HAND.    AFTER 17 MONTHS, WE RETURNED TO        47    00:05:02.235 --> 00:05:09.742    THIS YARD.    WE WAGED WAR ON COCKROACHES,        48    00:05:09.742 --> 00:05:21.154    MICE, AND FUNGI.    WE DISCOVERED THAT PALLID        49    00:05:21.154 --> 00:05:33.499    PHANTOMS ONCE SEEN IN A MADE-UP    WORLD        50    00:05:33.499 --> 00:05:38.171    CALLED ZOOMLAND WERE IN FACT    CLASSMATES AND FRIENDS WITH        51    00:05:38.171 --> 00:05:53.152    ACTUAL, PHYSICAL BODIES.    (CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)        52    00:05:53.152 --> 00:05:56.622    AT THE SAME TIME WE LOOKED AGAIN    FOR THE HOME WE HAD LOST IN        53    00:05:56.622 --> 00:06:03.529    MARCH, 2020.    LAST FALL, I WENT INTO ANNENBERG        54    00:06:03.529 --> 00:06:13.206    FOR A MEAL.    JOHN WAS NOT THERE.        55    00:06:13.206 --> 00:06:21.447    SADDENED, I WAS LEAVING BY THE    BACK DOOR, WHEN        56    00:06:21.447 --> 00:06:26.018    THERE HE WAS, ENJOYING A    MID-MORNING BREAK WITH HIS        57    00:06:26.018 --> 00:06:28.955    COWORKERS.    "JOHN!" I CRIED.        58    00:06:28.955 --> 00:06:33.459    "BEN!" HE RESPONDED WITHOUT THE    LEAST HESITATION.        59    00:06:33.459 --> 00:06:39.465    "JOHN," I SAID, SCARCELY    BELIEVING MY EARS        60    00:06:39.465 --> 00:06:46.172    "WHERE IS YOUR CLOUD STORAGE?"    HE JUST LAUGHED        61    00:06:46.172 --> 00:06:52.812    BUT AT HIS LAUGH I HAD FOUND MY    HOME AGAIN.        62    00:06:52.812 --> 00:07:15.067    (CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)

title: Graduate English Address | Harvard Commencement 2022
desc: Graduate Lindsay Sanwald, M.Div â€™22 delivered the Graduate English Address at Harvard's 2022 Commencement Exercises.
speech_raw: 1    00:00:00.700 --> 00:00:07.173    A LONG WHILE FROM NOW, LIVING    BEINGS NOT YET BORN TODAY WILL        2    00:00:07.173 --> 00:00:12.645    WANT TO KNOW WHERE WERE YOU WHEN    THE WORLD STOPPED?        3    00:00:12.645 --> 00:00:16.583    IT COULD BE YOUR FUTURE    GRANDDAUGHTER, INTERVIEWING YOU        4    00:00:16.583 --> 00:00:20.920    FOR HER MIDDLE SCHOOL RESEARCH    PROJECT ON THE CORONAVIRUS.        5    00:00:20.920 --> 00:00:25.558    OR PERHAPS YOU'LL BE WRITING A    CHAPTER ABOUT IT IN YOUR        6    00:00:25.558 --> 00:00:29.229    PRESIDENTIAL MEMOIR.    HOW WILL YOU TELL THIS TIME?        7    00:00:29.229 --> 00:00:32.565    FOR MANY OF US HERE TODAY, WE    GET TO ANSWER THAT WE WERE        8    00:00:32.565 --> 00:00:36.036    STUDENTS AT HARVARD WHEN THE    WORLD TOOK ITS GREAT PAUSE.        9    00:00:36.036 --> 00:00:40.573    I'VE BEEN A STUDENT AT HARVARD    FOR THREE YEARS, YET THIS IS        10    00:00:40.573 --> 00:00:44.577    STRANGELY BOTH MY FIRST AND    FINAL SPRING ON CAMPUS.        11    00:00:44.577 --> 00:00:52.619    I BEGAN IN THE FALL OF 2019 AS A    FULLY EMBODIED PRESENCE IN THE        12    00:00:52.619 --> 00:00:59.225    CLASSROOMS, BUT THEN-- VERY    SUDDENLY -- THIS ALL DISAPPEARED.        13    00:00:59.225 --> 00:01:02.929    WHEN I RETURNED TO CAMBRIDGE    THIS PAST FALL, IT FELT LIKE A        14    00:01:02.929 --> 00:01:05.832    REINCARNATION.    I'VE BEEN HERE BEFORE, I        15    00:01:05.832 --> 00:01:11.071    THOUGHT, IN A PAST LIFE.    WHAT HAPPENED?        16    00:01:11.071 --> 00:01:16.743    WHERE DID WE GO?    AND WHAT MIRACLE IS THIS THAT WE        17    00:01:16.743 --> 00:01:21.481    GET TO BE HERE TOGETHER AGAIN    TODAY?        18    00:01:21.481 --> 00:01:29.889    (CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)    WHETHER YOU STARTED OUT IN THE        19    00:01:29.889 --> 00:01:32.992    FLESH OR ON THE SCREEN, COVID-19    BECAME AN ALL-CONSUMING        20    00:01:32.992 --> 00:01:36.529    COMPONENT OF YOUR CURRICULUM.    MUCH OF OUR STUDY HAPPENED IN        21    00:01:36.529 --> 00:01:40.066    QUARANTINE, IN A CLOISTER CALLED        22    00:01:40.066 --> 00:01:43.203    ZOOM.    I HAD ALREADY BEEN PRACTICING A        23    00:01:43.203 --> 00:01:45.972    BIT OF THIS MONASTIC LIFE AT THE    DIVINITY SCHOOL, THAT OLD PLACE        24    00:01:45.972 --> 00:01:48.441    AT THE EDGE OF CAMPUS WHERE    FOLKS OF EVERY FAITH GO IN        25    00:01:48.441 --> 00:01:54.314    SEARCH OF HOW TO THINK AND TALK    ABOUT THE DIVINE.        26    00:01:54.314 --> 00:01:59.452    YES, WHAT'S UP THIS SCHOOL?    NOT EVERYONE KNOWS THAT HARVARD        27    00:01:59.452 --> 00:02:03.990    COLLEGE WAS INITIALLY FOUNDED AS    A PLACE TO TRAIN FUTURE        28    00:02:03.990 --> 00:02:05.792    MINISTERS.    I AM DELIGHTED TO BE A        29    00:02:05.792 --> 00:02:12.565    CONTINUATION OF THE ORIGINAL    MISSION, AND LOVE THAT MY        30    00:02:12.565 --> 00:02:26.946    PRESENCE HERE TODAY AS A PROUD    QUEER HEATHEN WOMAN AND        31    00:02:26.946 --> 00:02:29.949    FIRST GENERATION GRADUATE --    (APPLAUSE)        32    00:02:29.949 --> 00:02:40.527    ALL OF THAT WOULD PROBABLY MAKE    THE FIRST GENERATION PURITAN        33    00:02:40.527 --> 00:02:48.401    CLERGY WHO ESTABLISHED THIS    INSTITUTION VERY UNCOMFORTABLE.        34    00:02:48.401 --> 00:02:52.672    THESE YEARS, I THINK WE WERE ALL    MADE INTO MINISTERS.        35    00:02:52.672 --> 00:02:54.040    WE WERE ALL CALLED TO SIT WITH    GREAT GRIEF AS WE STUDIED THE        36    00:02:54.040 --> 00:02:56.576    SELF.    WE WERE ALL ASKED TO MAKE        37    00:02:56.576 --> 00:02:59.979    MEANING OF OUR LIVES WHEN    EVERYTHING SEEMED LOST.        38    00:02:59.979 --> 00:03:04.617    AND IT IS MY SINCERE BELIEF THAT    TO HAVE BEEN A STUDENT DURING        39    00:03:04.617 --> 00:03:11.491    THESE PANDEMIC TIMES WAS AN    IMMENSE BLESSING.        40    00:03:11.491 --> 00:03:17.530    IT TAUGHT US SOMETHING ABOUT    STILLNESS, ABOUT        41    00:03:17.530 --> 00:03:19.566    HOW TO LISTEN, HOW TO RECOGNIZE    WHAT IS MOST PRECIOUS AND FAR        42    00:03:19.566 --> 00:03:23.903    TOO OFTEN TAKEN FOR GRANTED:    THIS PRIVILEGE OF BEING ALIVE.        43    00:03:23.903 --> 00:03:28.675    IT SHOWED US JUST HOW VULNERABLE    WE ARE.        44    00:03:28.675 --> 00:03:34.581    BUT HERE'S THE GIFT.    TO BE MADE        45    00:03:34.581 --> 00:03:35.815    VULNERABLE IS TO BECOME    VISIONARY.        46    00:03:35.815 --> 00:03:40.520    TO BE HUMAN IS TO BE THROWN INTO    THE DEEP END OF MYSTERY.        47    00:03:40.520 --> 00:03:44.057    WE STAY AFLOAT ON HOPE, AND HOPE    IS A PROPHECY.        48    00:03:44.057 --> 00:03:47.427    HOPE IS AN OPTIMISTIC ORACLE    TELLING A STORY.        49    00:03:47.427 --> 00:03:52.632    IT ANTICIPATES WHAT IS POSSIBLE    AND CALLS FORTH A BETTER FUTURE.        50    00:03:52.632 --> 00:03:56.669    HOPE IS RISKY BECAUSE IT ASKS    YOU TO EXPOSE YOURSELF, TO        51    00:03:56.669 --> 00:04:00.673    UNMUTE YOURSELF, TO TAKE OFF    YOUR MASK, TURN ON YOUR CAMERA,        52    00:04:00.673 --> 00:04:08.648    AND TELL YOUR STORY.    HERE IS A BIT OF MINE.        53    00:04:08.648 --> 00:04:12.685    MY GREAT GRANDMOTHER RAN AWAY    FROM HOME IN KYIV AT AGE 18.        54    00:04:12.685 --> 00:04:16.689    IT WAS CALLED RUSSIA BACK THEN.    LEGEND HAS IT SHE BRIBED A GUARD        55    00:04:16.689 --> 00:04:22.595    WITH A BOTTLE OF VODKA TO GET ON    A BOAT TO MANHATTAN.        56    00:04:22.595 --> 00:04:24.130    SHE WORKED AS A TAILOR IN A    TENEMENT BUILDING IN THE LOWER        57    00:04:24.130 --> 00:04:25.765    EAST SIDE, WHERE SHE BREWED    MOONSHINE IN A BATHTUB AND THREW        58    00:04:25.765 --> 00:04:32.171    PARTIES DURING PROHIBITION.    SHE PULLED MY GRANDMOTHER SONIA        59    00:04:32.171 --> 00:04:35.942    OUT OF SCHOOL AT AGE 15 TO HELP    SEW CLOTHES ON DELANCEY STREET.        60    00:04:35.942 --> 00:04:40.647    MY GRANDMOTHER AND GREAT    GRANDMOTHER WERE LEGIT WOMEN OF        61    00:04:40.647 --> 00:04:42.849    THE CLOTH-- NOT LEADERS OF THE    CLERGY, BUT SACRED SEAMSTRESSES        62    00:04:42.849 --> 00:04:47.987    WHO KNEW HOW TO STITCH THE    FABRIC TOGETHER.        63    00:04:47.987 --> 00:04:52.292    THEIR COURAGE AND SACRIFICE    STITCHED A FUTURE FOR ME.        64    00:04:52.292 --> 00:04:59.365    WE ARE ALL BEING TASKED NOW AT    MENDING OURSELVES BACK TOGETHER        65    00:04:59.365 --> 00:05:00.466    SO THAT WE CAN STITCH A WORLD    FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS.        66    00:05:00.466 --> 00:05:04.404    AFTER ALL THAT'S BEEN    SACRIFICED, I REFUSE TO WASTE MY        67    00:05:04.404 --> 00:05:08.574    VISION ENDLESSLY THUMBING A    SCROLL OF SCREEN.        68    00:05:08.574 --> 00:05:12.245    WE ARE RENAISSANCE ARTISTS    REBORN AFTER A PLAGUE!        69    00:05:12.245 --> 00:05:17.850    I WANT US TO MAKE MORE THAN    MEMES; I WANT US TO MAKE        70    00:05:17.850 --> 00:05:26.592    MASTERPIECES!    (CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)        71    00:05:26.592 --> 00:05:28.895    A FRIEND IN A DREAM TELLS ME NOW    IS THE TIME WE'RE SUPPOSED TO        72    00:05:28.895 --> 00:05:34.133    BECOME THE PEOPLE WE'LL BE    REMEMBERED AS.        73    00:05:34.133 --> 00:05:40.640    WE HAVE NEVER BEEN MORE    VULNERABLE THAN WE ARE TODAY.        74    00:05:40.640 --> 00:05:44.544    GOOD!    MAY THIS GREAT VULNERABILITY        75    00:05:44.544 --> 00:05:56.556    TURN US INTO GREAT VISIONARIES!    IN EXILE, WE BECOME PROPHETS, WE        76    00:05:56.556 --> 00:05:59.225    PART SEAS, WE LEAP!    YOU HAVE MADE A PATH FOR        77    00:05:59.225 --> 00:06:03.029    YOURSELF.    NOW, CROSS IT.        78    00:06:03.029 --> 00:06:08.568    GO FORTH AND SHARE ALL THAT YOU    HAVE LEARNED.        79    00:06:08.568 --> 00:06:11.571    BE CONTAGIOUS WITH YOUR    KNOWLEDGE, CONTAGIOUS WITH YOUR        80    00:06:11.571 --> 00:06:15.274    KINDNESS, CONTAGIOUS WITH YOUR    ENTHUSIASM AND YOUR INSPIRED        81    00:06:15.274 --> 00:06:19.979    HUMAN VISION.    LET US GO BEYOND THE BOUNDARIES,        82    00:06:19.979 --> 00:06:23.483    NOW, AND MAY DIVINE WISDOM TRUTH    AND GRACE        83    00:06:23.483 --> 00:06:41.868    CONTINUE TO GUIDE OUR WAY.    (APPLAUSE)

title: Senior English Address | Harvard Commencement 2022
desc: Graduate Noah Harris â€™22 delivered the Senior English Address at Harvard's 2022 Commencement Exercises.
speech_raw: 1    00:00:00.400 --> 00:00:06.973    "I KNOW WHY THE CAGED BIRD    SINGS," WROTE MAYA ANGELOU.        2    00:00:06.973 --> 00:00:12.379    GROWING UP, I ALWAYS WONDERED,    WHY WOULD A CAGED BIRD SING?        3    00:00:12.379 --> 00:00:16.483    WHAT DOES IT REALLY MEAN TO BE        4    00:00:16.483 --> 00:00:20.387    CAGED?    SIMPLY, BEING CAGED IS ABOUT        5    00:00:20.387 --> 00:00:24.391    CONFINEMENT, WHETHER LITERALLY    OR FIGURATIVELY.        6    00:00:24.391 --> 00:00:29.029    WHEN I WAS LITTLE, I WAS REALLY    SHY.        7    00:00:29.029 --> 00:00:35.668    I WAS NOT COMFORTABLE SPEAKING    TO PEOPLE AT ALL.        8    00:00:35.668 --> 00:00:41.674    WHEN THE TIME CAME TO SPEAK, I    WOULD JUST FEEL TRAPPED.        9    00:00:41.674 --> 00:00:45.478    THAT CHANGED WHETHER MY PARENTS    HELPED ME FIND MY VOICE.        10    00:00:45.478 --> 00:00:48.815    THEY REFUSED TO ALLOW ME TO BE    CAGED IN ANY WAY, SO WHEN THERE        11    00:00:48.815 --> 00:00:51.785    WAS AN EVENT AT SCHOOL, I WOULD    HAVE TO SPEAK.        12    00:00:51.785 --> 00:00:54.988    IF THERE WAS A PLAY AT CHURCH, I    WOULD HAVE TO ACT.        13    00:00:54.988 --> 00:01:01.061    MY DAD EVEN HAD ME IN THE CAR    REPEATING EVERY SENTENCE I WOULD        14    00:01:01.061 --> 00:01:08.435    HEAR ON THE NEWS SO MY VOICE    WOULD NEVER FEEL CAGED AGAIN.        15    00:01:08.435 --> 00:01:14.407    THE CAGED BIRD SINGS OF HOPE.    MOST FORMS OF CONFINEMENT ARE        16    00:01:14.407 --> 00:01:17.143    NOT AS MANAGEABLE AS SHYNESS.    I THINK OF MY ANCESTORS WHO WERE        17    00:01:17.143 --> 00:01:20.413    ENSLAVED WHERE I AM FROM IN    MISSISSIPPI.        18    00:01:20.413 --> 00:01:24.517    THEY WERE CAGED, AND YET THEY    SANG.        19    00:01:24.517 --> 00:01:28.455    THEY SANG SPIRITUALS SUCH AS    "WADE IN THE WATER" AS THEY        20    00:01:28.455 --> 00:01:32.125    WORKED TO COMMUNICATE THAT THE    WATER WAS A MUCH MORE DISCRETE        21    00:01:32.125 --> 00:01:36.463    ROUTE OF ESCAPE FOR THOSE    FLEEING TO THE NORTH.        22    00:01:36.463 --> 00:01:39.966    MY ANCESTORS WORKED AND SANG IN    THE FIELDS SO ONE DAY I COULD BE        23    00:01:39.966 --> 00:01:43.903    FREE IN THE PURSUIT OF MY    DREAMS.        24    00:01:43.903 --> 00:01:47.674    WHEN I BEGAN LOOKING AT    COLLEGES, I THOUGHT HARVARD WAS        25    00:01:47.674 --> 00:01:56.216    NOT POSSIBLE FOR ME.    IT TOOK MY MOM WHO HAD BEEN A        26    00:01:56.216 --> 00:01:59.652    GUIDANCE COUNSELOR FOR OVER 25    YEARS TO CONVINCE ME THAT I WAS        27    00:01:59.652 --> 00:02:08.428    ENOUGH.    (CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)        28    00:02:08.428 --> 00:02:14.134    WE HAD NOT COME THIS FAR AS A    FAMILY AND AS A PEOPLE FOR ME TO        29    00:02:14.134 --> 00:02:16.402    SHY AWAY FROM CHASING THE DREAMS    MY ANCESTORS WERE NEVER ABLE TO        30    00:02:16.402 --> 00:02:20.874    PURSUE.    BECAUSE OF HER ENCOURAGEMENT, I        31    00:02:20.874 --> 00:02:23.910    WENT FROM CONSIDERING NOT    SUBMITTING THE HARVARD        32    00:02:23.910 --> 00:02:28.381    APPLICATION TO BEING THE FIRST    BLACK MAN ELECTED STUDENT BODY        33    00:02:28.381 --> 00:02:32.418    PRESIDENT IN HARVARD COLLEGE'S    386-YEAR HISTORY.        34    00:02:32.418 --> 00:03:04.350    (CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)    THE CAGED BIRD SINGS OF        35    00:03:04.350 --> 00:03:08.421    RESILIENCE.    THROUGHOUT THIS PANDEMIC, ALL OF        36    00:03:08.421 --> 00:03:13.893    US HAVE BEEN CAGED.    QUARANTINE, MASKING, VACCINES,        37    00:03:13.893 --> 00:03:16.696    AND CONTACT TRACING HAVE DEFINED    THE LAST TWO YEARS OF OUR LIVES.        38    00:03:16.696 --> 00:03:22.168    WE WERE CAGED, AND YET WE SANG.    WE SANG THROUGH OUR VIGILANCE TO        39    00:03:22.168 --> 00:03:26.139    COVID-19 PROTOCOLS.    WE SANG THROUGH A YEAR OF        40    00:03:26.139 --> 00:03:28.274    VIRTUAL LEARNING WITH OUR    CLASSMATES SCATTERED ACROSS THE        41    00:03:28.274 --> 00:03:33.846    GLOBE.    WE SANG FOR THIS MOMENT IN THIS        42    00:03:33.846 --> 00:03:38.785    HISTORIC THEATRE SO COLLECTIVELY    WE COULD SOAR INTO THE WORLD AS        43    00:03:38.785 --> 00:03:45.625    GRADUATES OF HARVARD, AS    GRADUATES OF TRUTH.        44    00:03:45.625 --> 00:03:50.630    THE CAGED BIRD SINGS OF    EQUALITY.        45    00:03:50.630 --> 00:03:55.301    TODAY, AS WE GO BEYOND HARVARD'S    GATES TO PURSUE OUR DREAMS, THE        46    00:03:55.301 --> 00:03:58.671    ONLY WAY FOR US TO TRULY FLY    FREELY IS FOR US TO UPLIFT THOSE        47    00:03:58.671 --> 00:04:02.942    IN OUR COMMUNITIES WHO ARE STILL    CAGED.        48    00:04:02.942 --> 00:04:12.352    TODAY, I THINK OF THEM.    TODAY I THINK OF THE BLACK        49    00:04:12.352 --> 00:04:14.887    INCARCERATED MAN WHO WROTE ME A    LETTER FROM A FLORIDA        50    00:04:14.887 --> 00:04:19.092    PENITENTIARY WHO WAS JAILED FOR    15 MONTHS WITHOUT BAIL BEFORE HE        51    00:04:19.092 --> 00:04:22.795    WAS CHARGED WITH A NONVIOLENT    DRUG OFFENSE.        52    00:04:22.795 --> 00:04:26.933    HE TOLD ME TO KEEP GOING SO THAT    ONE DAY I COULD HELP PEOPLE LIKE        53    00:04:26.933 --> 00:04:32.572    HIM.    THIS WORLD EXPECTS BLACK MEN TO        54    00:04:32.572 --> 00:04:38.578    END UP IN PRISON OR IN A WORSE    SITUATION ENTIRELY.        55    00:04:38.578 --> 00:04:43.383    THERE ARE SO MANY DREAMS THIS    MAN WOULD RATHER BE CHASING THAT        56    00:04:43.383 --> 00:04:46.819    HE CANNOT BECAUSE HE IS CAGED.    BUT INSTEAD OF WRITING TO        57    00:04:46.819 --> 00:04:49.322    SOMEONE WHO WAS LEGALLY    QUALIFIED TO REPRESENT HIM, HE        58    00:04:49.322 --> 00:04:52.292    WROTE TO A BLACK MAN WHO    REPRESENTS THE SHARED DREAMS OF        59    00:04:52.292 --> 00:04:58.765    OUR PEOPLE.    AS WE GRADUATE, WE MUST SEE        60    00:04:58.765 --> 00:05:00.566    OURSELVES IN THOSE WHO ARE    CAGED.        61    00:05:00.566 --> 00:05:04.671    WE MUST USE OUR TALENTS TO HELP    THEM.        62    00:05:04.671 --> 00:05:08.908    BUT MOST OF ALL, WE MUST BE    WILLING TO BE PROXIMATE ENOUGH        63    00:05:08.908 --> 00:05:16.015    TO HEAR THE TUNE OF THEIR SONG.    AND WHEN WE QUESTION WHY ANYONE        64    00:05:16.015 --> 00:05:20.887    WOULD HAVE ENOUGH JOY TO SING    WHILE CAGED, THEY WILL TELL US        65    00:05:20.887 --> 00:05:26.059    THAT THEY SING SO THOSE WHO FLY    FREELY WILL HEAR THEIR STORY.        66    00:05:26.059 --> 00:05:31.864    I, TOO, KNOW WHY THE    CAGED BIRD SINGS.        67    00:05:31.864 --> 00:05:37.003    "THE CAGED BIRD SINGS OF    FREEDOM."        68    00:05:37.003 --> 00:05:58.725    (CHEERING AND APPLAUSE)

title: Stephanie Paulsell Delivers the Faculty Address at HDS's 2022 Multireligious Commencement Service
desc: Stephanie Paulsell, Susan Shallcross Swartz Professor of the Practice of Christian Studies, was the faculty speaker during the Harvard Divinity School Multireligious Commencement Service on May 25, 2022. The following remarks were delivered by Paulsell during the service at Memorial Church.        Her address was entitled, 'Creating from Fragments.'        For the full length service: https://youtu.be/h2ykVkbbnPA
speech_raw: 1    00:00:00.799 --> 00:00:05.640    and to the hds class of 2022        2    00:00:05.640 --> 00:00:07.919    congratulations on reaching this        3    00:00:07.919 --> 00:00:10.320    milestone on your path        4    00:00:10.320 --> 00:00:13.360    and thank you for inviting me to speak        5    00:00:13.360 --> 00:00:16.480    with you today        6    00:00:16.480 --> 00:00:19.119    graduation is always such a bittersweet        7    00:00:19.119 --> 00:00:20.480    time        8    00:00:20.480 --> 00:00:23.199    we're always so proud of our graduates        9    00:00:23.199 --> 00:00:26.400    so inspired by their accomplishments and        10    00:00:26.400 --> 00:00:28.080    aspirations        11    00:00:28.080 --> 00:00:29.439    and every year        12    00:00:29.439 --> 00:00:32.239    it's hard to say goodbye        13    00:00:32.239 --> 00:00:34.559    but this class        14    00:00:34.559 --> 00:00:36.399    well you're a bit different        15    00:00:36.399 --> 00:00:38.800    from all the other classes        16    00:00:38.800 --> 00:00:40.879    we have ever celebrated        17    00:00:40.879 --> 00:00:44.920    and bid farewell to        18    00:00:45.920 --> 00:00:48.320    because you're the ones whose faces we        19    00:00:48.320 --> 00:00:52.480    looked forward to seeing on our screens        20    00:00:52.480 --> 00:00:55.680    as we sat alone at our desks or at our        21    00:00:55.680 --> 00:00:58.800    kitchen tables last year waiting for        22    00:00:58.800 --> 00:01:01.520    class to begin        23    00:01:01.520 --> 00:01:04.799    your cats prowled with our cats through        24    00:01:04.799 --> 00:01:07.840    our virtual classrooms        25    00:01:07.840 --> 00:01:10.320    we learned the names of your dogs and        26    00:01:10.320 --> 00:01:13.439    you learned the names of ours        27    00:01:13.439 --> 00:01:16.479    your children and our
