  00:22:22.696 --> 00:22:27.168    That means many creative minds are left out of this discussion.        193    00:22:27.168 --> 00:22:39.152    Smart people with practical intelligence and relevant 00:24:23.649 --> 00:24:30.000    Should Harvard encourage its faculty to take on the worlds worst inequities?        205    00:24:30.022 --> 00:24:36.700    [Applause.]        206    00:24:36.720 --> diseases we can cure?        207    00:24:54.495 --> 00:25:01.063    Should the worlds most privileged learn about the lives of the worlds least privileged?        208    00:25:01.063 --> 00:25:05.800    These are not rhetorical questions.        209    00:25:05.827 --> 00:25:12.000    [Applause.]        210    00:25:12.011 --> 00:25:14.900    You will answer with your policies        211    00:25:14.910 --> 00:25:25.000    My mother who was filled with pride the day I was admitted here, never stopped pressing me to do more for others.        212    00:25:25.020 --> 00:25:33.825    A few few hours every week you can use the growing power of the internet to get informed, find others with the same interests, see the barriers and find ways to cut through them.        221    00:26:50.422 which we did not have.        227    00:27:19.593 --> 00:27:31.700    And with that awareness, you likely also have an informed conscience that will torment if you abandon these people whose lives you could change with modest effort.        228    00:27:31.733 --> 00:27:37.700    You have more than we had, you must start sooner and carry on longer.        229    00:27:37.711 --> 00:27:49.600    And all and we thank you for being here today.        236    00:29:34.462 --> 00:29:44.500    Please stand and join me now as we sing Fair Harvard, the words are included in your programme.        237    00:29:44.543 --> 00:32:15.300    [Fair Harvard Hymn with marching band music.]        238    00:32:15.312 --> 00:32:23.797    [Drum roll then clapping.]        239    00:32:23.797 --> 00:32:33.700 reconvened on June 5th 2008.        249    00:33:29.783 --> 00:33:31.100    Thank you all for coming.        250    00:33:31.105 --> 00:33:31.800    [Gavel knocks against wood.]        251 to make the world a better place.        258    00:34:11.202 --> 00:34:20.693    Bill Gates talked about his own journey from chairman of Microsoft to thinking about how to give back to the world.        259    00:34:20.693 --> 00:34:30.195    And his journey with his wife to discover that diseases are in fact eradicable in our lifetimes.        260    00:34:30.195 --> 00:34:44.400    And he and his wife are on a mission to, work to, eliminate the diseases of malaria, measles, rotavirus which as he says kills millions of people. Tuberculosis.        261    00:34:44.446 --> 00:34:54.200    He talked about the complexity of these sorts of problems and urged the graduates not to allow complexity to deter them.        262    00:34:54.243 --> 00:35:04.400    He likened his mission to the Mar- mission of the Marshall plan which George Marshall announced here at the Harvard commencement in 1947.        263    00:35:04.442 --> 00:35:13.676    And he urged the graduates to make the world a better place, even if it was only in their spare time.        264    00:35:13.676 --> 00:35:25.900    (Male commentator again:)    And with that, ringing message, we bring to a close this annual afternoon exercises at Harvard Yard at the tercentenary theater.        265    00:35:25.920 --> 00:35:37.200    glad to have had you here and hope you have enjoyed it as much as all the people in this wonderful theater did.        266    00:35:37.247 --> 00:35:41.400    Thank you and until next year, farewell.        267    00:35:43.592 --> 00:35:52.600    (Subtitles by Adnan Mehrban)

title: Harvard's Latin Salutatory Address 2007

title: Brooke Ellison's Commencement Address at Harvard (June, 2000)
desc: **Updated on 2/5/2024**    VERY SAD NEWS, From Brooke's Facebook page (posted by her brother), on February 4, 2024:     Saying Goodbye -    It is with great sadness that we, the Ellison family, share the news of the passing of our cherished Brooke.  She lived an extraordinary life and the world lost a truly incredible person today.     Her friends and family were everything to her, and we want to say goodbye to all of you on her behalf.  To quote Brooke herself, "My friends and family have made my life and all of the events in it either more bearable when they were difficult or more beautiful when they were not.  I love you more than I can quantify or, despite my love for words, could ever fully articulate."    Details regarding funeral and memorial arrangements will follow in the days ahead.        Brooke Ellison's Graduation Speech at Harvard

title: Excerpts of Gen. Colin Powell 1993 Commencement Speech
desc: In 1993 Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, Colin Powell gave a commencement speech to the graduating class at Harvard University.  It was the first time since 1946 that a member of the military had given the commencement speech.  In 1946 it was General George Marshall.  He announced the Marshall Plan.  General Colin Powell announced the Powell Plan - not in those words but in the idea.  Powell announced that the U.S. was going to finance and assist in the rebuilding of Russia and the independent states as the U.S. financed and assisted in the rebuilding of Europe following WWII.
